loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a single 31-year-old mother of four children between the ages of 12 and 7 years, has been selling clothing in an Eldama ravine location for a period of 13 years. She earns a monthly income of kes 13,000.


Jane has requested her seventh loan of kes 120,000 from KADET LTD  to buy more clothes for resale.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and purchase more clothes for her business.


Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a businesswoman with five children who are school and adult-aged. Merlyn is 40 years old, and lives in Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor.

Merlyn has been engaged in the poultry business to earn a living for almost one year. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to be used to purchase additional feed and chickens. 

Merlyn is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to increase their standard of living with this help.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and chickens.

loans.name: Poetas Group

texts.es: La población de Zitacuaro se caracteriza como una ciudad de progreso, donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica al comercio. Daniela tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija pequeña la cual todavía no estudia, platica que ella estudio hasta la secundaria y cuando creció se le hizo muy difícil encontrar un trabajo bien pagado y donde pudiera tener días de descanso es por eso que mejor decidió poner una lavandería la cual la puso en casa de sus padres ya que pudo acondicionar un cuarto. Con su propio negocio, Daniela podía estar al pendiente de su casa y de su familia. Dice que emprendió este tipo de negocio por que una vez se metió a trabajar a una lavandería y ella veía que aunque era un trabajo difícil tenía buenas ganancias. Ella ahorita está solicitando un crédito, dice que su hermana fue la que la invito a su grupo llamado Poetas, para que pidiera un crédito ya que vio que tiene varios problemas con sus maquinas para lavar y secar dice Daniela “ahorita estoy teniendo muchos problemas para entregar a tiempo la lavandería ya que me tardo un poco mas por que dos secadoras y una lavadora se me descompusieron y necesito capital para poder componerlas y así sacar mis pendientes y no quedarle mal a mi clientela”. Ella invertirá también en productos para el lavado de la ropa. Comenta que su sueño es poder comprar otras tres lavadoras con secadoras que sean nuevas ya que las que tiene las compro de medio uso. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Rodrigo, Irma, Ricarda, Teresa, Eduardo, Beatriz, Elizabeth, Pablo y Roberto ellos invertirán para sus negocios de  compra de refacciones y aceites para vehículo, peluquería, compra y venta de congelados, compra de material y líquidos para estética unisex, en la compra de insumos para hacer antojitos mexicanos, para la compra de dulces, frituras para su venta, para surtir frutas y legumbres de temporada y para surtir ropa y zapatos por catalogo.
texts.en:
Zitacuaro is characterized as a city of progress, where the majority of the inhabitants work in trade. Daniela is 19 years old, married and has a young daughter who is not yet in school. Daniela explains that she went to school until secondary school, and when she grew up it was difficult for her to find a well-paid job where she could also have days off. So she decided she should open a laundry service, which she established out of her parents' house since she could set up a room for it there. 

With her own business, Daniela was able to keep an eye on her house and her family. She says that she started this type of business because she once worked in a laundry and she saw that, though it was a difficult job, it was profitable. She is now requesting a loan, and says that it was her sister who invited her to join her group, Poetas, in order to ask for it, as she saw that Daniela was having some problems with her washing and drying machines. Daniela says, "At the moment I am having a lot of problems with turning in the laundry on time, since it takes me a bit longer because two dryers and a washer have broken down, and I need capital to be able to fix them, so I can finish my pending work and not let my clients down."

She will also invest in products for washing clothes. She says her dream is to be able to buy three washer-dryer combos-- new ones, as the ones she has, she bought used. 

The other members of the group are Rodrigo, Irma, Ricarda, Teresa, Eduardo, Beatriz, Elizabeth, Pablo, and Roberto. They will invest their part of the loan in their businesses of buying car parts and oils, running a hair salon, buying and selling frozen foods, buying material and liquids for a unisex beauty salon, buying supplies to make traditional corn-based Mexican dishes, buying sweets and fried foods to sell, stocking seasonal fruits and vegetables and stocking clothes and shoes to sell by catalog.

loans.use: to maintain washers and dryers and to buy laundry supplies.

loans.name: Kumomoru

texts.en:
Kumomoru is 35 years old, married to Eunice and a father of four. His children are nine, five, three, and one years old. He is a livestock trader in Lower Melili area of Narok County, Kenya. He has been running the business for the past six years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. He learned about KADET from fellow farmers in his area.

He has borrowed a third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET after successfully paying of his previous loans. Kumomoru intends to purchase more livestock for resale, as well as to diversify into crop farming. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business, as well as used to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to expand his farming business and attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for sale

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 52-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a hawker and sells fruits in their hometown. Every day he goes to fruit markets to buy fresh fruits such as mangoes, bananas, apples and more. He is very famous in the community due to the freshness of the fruits he sells. He has been selling fruits for many years; because of this he understands the mind and demand of people. 

It is very difficult for Parveen to feed all of her children in a day. Initially she faced a lot of financial problems, but now her sons are grown and equally participating in the monthly income. Parveen has requested a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more fruits, especially bananas.

Parveen is representing herself as a group leader and taking responsibility for her group members. This is the third loan for Parveen. She assured the field partner that she will pay all installments on time or earlier because she wants to take another loan in the future. 

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Parveen raises her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Foster's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two entrepreneurs. One of them is Foster. He is 47 years old, married and has two children. For six years he has had a business selling maize and millet. 

The two group members have been clients of ID-Ghana for four years. His portion of the loan amount, GHS 2,000, will be used to purchase two bags of maize (corn) and millet, which he will sell to customers. With the profits from his business, he will be able to reinvest, save and cater to his children.

Konadu is 28 years old, and she is a wig seller. In total, this group of two needs GHS 2,500 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of maize (corn) and millet to sell to customers.

loans.name: Phytline

texts.en:
Phytline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from her shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger earns a living dealing Avon beauty products. He is 37 years old, married, and lives in Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte.

He is well known for his good communications in dealing with his customers. He has already purchased some new products, and has been able to save. His services are self-sustainable, and have become profitable, with a net profit of about Php 3,000 per month.  

Roger is seeking a Php 5,000 loan. He would like to use the loan to purchase addtional items to sell. This is a microfinance loan, and would be repaid in a few months. 

This is his first loan in the cooperative. Roger is very diligent, and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of his venture.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

location.town: SINDANGAN-MANIL, LEON B. POSTIGO, ZAMBOANGA DEL NO

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old and lives in Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor. She is married with two children who are school-aged. Evangeline engages in fish vending activities to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. 

Evangeline has requested a loan amounting to PHP 2,000 to be used in purchasing additional fishing equipment and fish to sell. She is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment and fish to sell

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es:
Carlos, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar papel, tinta, Dvd y Cd, repuestos para la fotocopiadora y otros. 
Comenta que el crédito fue positivo, ya que hizo algunas actualizaciones a las maquinas y adquirir otros accesorios para el ciber, mejorar al hogar; es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting this new loan because he needs more working capital to continue with his business. He will use the loan to buy paper, ink, DVDs, CDs, photocopier supplies and other items for his Internet cafe. 

Carlos says that the previous loan was very helpful because it allowed him to make updates to his computers, buy more accessories for his Internet cafe, and improve his home. He says that his family’s economic situation has greatly improved because of the loan

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, DVDs, CDs, photocopier supplies and other items for his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Keko

texts.en:
Keko is 56 years old and a father of five children. He is a livestock trader in the Olopito area. He has been running the business for the past 10 years, making a monthly income of KES 28,000.

Keko has borrowed his eleventh loan of KES 80,000 from KADET, which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business as well as to diversify into farming. His hope is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, age 42, has been involved in a business selling clothes for a period of about 10 years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothes from the main city market, and then sells to the people of her local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. The winter season is going to start soon, and she wants to buy clothes for the winter season.

Bushra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy stock of different clothes for the winter season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a high quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

Bushra thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica lives in Kilifi area in Kenya. She is 25 years old and married with two children. She started her business from a small amount of savings that she had made. She knew about Milango through friends, and she decided to join so that she could access credit to fund her business. She has been in the dairy farming business for the last three years, and it is the sole income earning activity for her. 

Scolastica now asks for a loan to pay school fees for her children. She believes that her business will be able to generate enough income for her to repay the loan and let her children attend school. She hopes to diversify and open a shop in the next five years.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Fakry Group

texts.en:
Fakry group consists of four women who are friends from the same village. Residents of Hodeida, Yemen, the group is requesting a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB in order to increase the members' activity levels. 


Salama, the 43-year-old leader of the group, has been selling clothes in her region for five years. She has requested a loan portion of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a supply of fabrics in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabrics in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income.

loans.name: Florie

texts.en:
Florie has just opened her bar-café which is located near a high school building of a town. So far, it has been frequented by students and teachers, and she is content with the activity and the income she’s been generating. 

Florie worked for a large communication corporation until recently, when she was laid off. “I didn’t even think for a second what would I be doing next. I am 50 now, and I wanted to do something different from what I did for all these past years, and something that I would enjoy doing. And indeed, I enjoy running my own thing now,” said Florie.

Florie wants to stock up on inventory items because school is starting soon, and she needs to have inventory on hand.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items for her lilttle bar-cafe

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica appreciates the previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used to open a food kiosk. She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka, age 30, is from Batumi, the seaside city on the Black Sea coast. Batumi is an important port and commercial center and most of its economy revolves around tourism. 

Mamuka is married and has an eight-year-old daughter who goes to the local school. He is employed by a private company, making deliveries. He gets a small salary (approximately USD 240 per month). Mamuka’s wife is involved in a cosmetics-trading business from her house. Her regular customers are women from the local community. The income from this activity is unstable and small, as well. The couple works hard, but their earnings are not enough to cover food and daily expenses. 

Mamuka owns a flat in the city center, which is not renovated. That is the reason why he had applied for the credit, to repair it for renting out. With the received credit, Mamuka will purchase all the needed construction materials for the flat's renovation. Afterward, it will be rented out and the family will get additional income to satisfy their daily needs. Mamuka awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to renovate his flat, so he can receive rental income.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Please meet Felecia, 33 years old, from Liberia.  To be precise, she lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia and well-known for that.  

Felecia is married and has five children. Her first child's age is 17, and her last child's age is 2. Among her five children, four are in school and all live at home.  Felecia did not extend her own education, due to some financial problems. She stopped in the 4th grade. 

For the past ten years she has run a shop where she sells fashion clothes, biscuits, etc.  She started this business with a little money from her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She sells for ten hours each day. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fashion clothes, biscuits, etc., to increase her business. Her plans are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fashion clothes, biscuits, etc., to increase her business.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Doña Ignacia tiene 32 años de edad, madre de 7 hijos de los cuales están en la primaria en una escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación, ama de casa, agricultora, con 6 años de educación cursando la primaria en su totalidad. Ella en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos de dedican a la siembra de hortalizas como ser: papa, brócoli y coliflor hace más de 10 años lo cual aprendió de sus padres a muy temprana edad ya que ellos son agricultores desde toda una vida y de generaciones. El terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja de hogar trabaja es propio y está ubicado cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para dar asistencia a sus cultivos involucrándose su familia solamente.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar insumos como coliflor, manzate, fertilizantes, formula 12-24-12, brócoli (Semilla Certificada) para sus cultivos ya que necesita mantenerlo protegidos de plagas, enfermedades para obtener una buena ganancia al final de la cosecha.
Sus sueños es dar a sus hijos una buena educación a nivel universitario verlos crecer como personas y como profesionales ya que es lo menos que ellos se merecen. Sus metas son las de poder dar una excelente asistencia a sus para obtener una buena cosecha y seguir formando y fortaleciendo poco a poco el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 32 years old.  She is the mother of seven children who attend the community elementary school and are in various grades.  She is a housewife and farmer, with six years of elementary education in total.  For over ten years, she and her husband and children have been engaged in planting vegetables such as potatoes, broccoli, and cauliflower.  She learned from her parents at a very young age because they have been farmers all their lives and the family has been engaged in farming for generations. She and her partner own the land that they work. Their parcel is located near their home and they travel daily on foot to take care of the crops, an activity in which only the family is involved.

She is requesting this loan from Comixmul cooperative to be able to purchase inputs such as cauliflower and broccoli (certified seeds), as well as “manzate” [fungicide], fertilizers, and formula 12-24-12 for her crops because she needs to keep them protected from pests and disease to obtain a good profit at the end of the harvest.

Her dream is to provide her children with a good college education and see them develop personally and professionally because it is the least they deserve.  Her goal is to be able to provide her crops with excellent care to obtain a good harvest and continue gradually forming and strengthening the legacy for her children.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs to care for and maintain her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She has operated a retail shop selling household consumables like wheat flour, soap, maize flour, and sugar. She cites price fluctuations as her major business challenge.

With the loan of KES 100,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, soap, salt, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, soap, salt,  rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, vive con su compañera de vida y no tiene hijos. El, se dedica a la venta de lácteos de casa en casa, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace dos años, lo desempeña todos los días de 1:00pm a 5:00pm con su esposa, trabaja en ese horario porque de 5:00am a 12:00pm realiza servicios varios donde un vecino.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar queso, crema, entre otros y para el mantenimiento de la refrigeradora que es donde los guarda. Esta inversión le ayudara a ofrecerle calidad de productos a los clientes y adquirirá mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es adquirir un local para su negocio y así vender más.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his life partner and has no children.  He sells dairy products door to door.  He has had this business for 2 years.  He works every day from 1 to 5pm with his wife.  He works these hours because from 5am to 12 noon he provides various services at a neighbor's house. 
The loan he is requesting will allow him to buy cheese and cream among other items, and make repairs on the refrigerator where he stores the products.  This investment will help him offer quality products to his customers and he will increase his income.  His dream is to acquire a shop for his business so he can sell more.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, cream, and other items and for refrigerator repairs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, a married woman who is very hardworking and enterprising, has been operating a clothes shop for the past year, selling clothes for  men, women and children. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 


Fatuma is requesting a loan of Kshs 25,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 54 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia which is well-known in Liberia. She is married and has three children aged between 18 and 35, who are presently in school and lives at home. Sophia's parents did not send her to school. 

For the past ten years she has been running a table where she sells fufu (dough made of cassava) and soap in the local market. She started this business by selling to her friends, which led to her establishing her own business, and she learned these ways of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profits and it keeps her busy. Most interestingly, she learned different kinds of local languages. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fufu and soap to increase her business. Her plans are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fufu and soap to increase her business.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo, de 62 años, es divorciado, pero tiene 7 hijos que son ya mayores, vive solo en su casa propia desde hace 6 años. Adolfo se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de motos y mototaxis. Tiene su taller instalado en su hogar y ahí se encarga de arreglar todos los vehículos que a diario le entregan para dejarlo en óptimas condiciones. Lleva en esta actividad desde hace 15 años y trabaja con la ayuda de 2 mecánicos que le ayudan a cubrir las necesidades de su amplia clientela. Tiene mucho acceso al público ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy concurrida por las personas y de fluido tránsito vehicular. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, no en vano lleva tantos años en este rubro, eso le ha permitido ganarse el respeto de sus clientes y consolidar su prestigio con la calidad de su trabajo final. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado comprará algunas piezas y repuestos que usa en la refacción de vehículos como embrague, cadenas, rodajes, llantas y otros.
texts.en: Adolfo is 62 years old.  He is divorced and has 7 grown children.  For the past 6 years he has lived alone in a house that he owns.  Adolfo repairs and performs maintenance on motorcycles and mototaxis.  Hi shop is at his home where he fixes all of the vehicles that are brought to him daily and leaves them in top shape.  He has done this work for 15 years, and has 2 mechanics who help him meet the needs of his large clientele. He has good access to the public because his shop is located in an area that has a lot of pedestrian and vehicular traffic.  He likes his work a lot. All of these years of work have not been in vain, as he had been able to gain the respect of his customers and consolidate his prestige with the quality of his finished products.  For this loan, he is requesting S/. 1800.  He thanks everyone for their continued trust in him and for providing access to this loan which will help him increase his working capital.  With this loan he will purchase parts that he uses to repair vehicles such as a clutch, chains, wheels, tires, etc.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts such as a clutch, chains, wheels, tires, etc.

loans.name: Grover Wladimir

texts.en:
Grover dreams of becoming a professional. Grover was accepted into the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, and now with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. He plans on graduating in December, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With this loan, Grover plans on purchasing his much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Grover feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Grover currently works 30 hours a week as an accounting assistant and earns $13 a day. With a degree in public accounting, he expects to earn $17 a day. 

With three older siblings attending college already, Grover is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Heyder Henri

texts.en:
Heyder dreams of working as a public accountant. Heyder is currently attending the Universidad Católica Boliviana San Pablo, working towards his degree in business. He plans on graduating in May, 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With this loan, Heyder plans to buy his school books. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. Working 25 hours a week, one of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school.  With a degree in business, he expects to earn $13 a day. 

With one older sibling attending college already, Heyder is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is divorced with five children and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

She has a business of a hardware shop and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy cement, iron bars, nails, and iron sheets. She works in a shop that she rents and works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of merchandise to her shop. 

She is aspiring of owing a fully stocked hardware store and also to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, iron bars, nails, and iron sheets.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, Salimata est âgée de 33 ans, et réside à  Koutiala (région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer sur ses études primaires, pour cela elle s’est basée sur les activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge auprès de sa mère. Son activité est basée sur l’achat - vente de tubercules, de fruits et légumes. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décida de  faire recours à    l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus de 8 ans.  Après avoir pris des prêts  solidaires (prêt de groupe)  tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 3ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 5 sacs d’igname, 5 sacs de patate douce et un panier de banane plantain en provenance de Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente à Koutiala  à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activités.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of five children, Salimata is 33 years old and lives in Koutiala (Sikasso region).

For societal reasons, she did not have the chance to finish her primary education. She then focused on revenue-generating activities alongside her mother. Her business is based on buying and selling tubers, fruits, and vegetables. 

In order to satisfy her clients, she decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso eight years ago. After having taken on group loans, all of which she properly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. Her past individual loans have been properly repaid. 

With this new loan, she would like to buy five sacks of yams, 5 sacks of sweet potatoes, and a basket of plantains – all from Sikasso. She buys her goods in Koutiala, and sells to men and women for cash and credit.

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA that she would like to use to repay the loan to Soro, help out with her family's household expenses, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy tubers and bananas.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jeanne is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jeanne has a buy-and-sell personal products business in the Philippines. Jeanne requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products, such as lotion, body spray, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Jeanne has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jeanne would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products, such as lotion, body spray, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar maní, azúcar, ropa, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le permitió  adquirir un efecto muy bueno, ya hoy en día el cliente es proveedor de tiendas y de otras personas que venden maní. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado notablemente.
texts.en:
Juan needs to apply for a new loan, as he requires more working capital to continue his business. Funds from this loan will help him purchase peanuts, sugar, clothes, and other goods. 

Juan's previous loan allowed him to purchase excellent merchandise. He has become a supplier to shops and other people who sell peanuts and his financial situation has improved greatly.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, sugar, clothes, and other goods.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco, a sus 48 años de edad es casado y padre de dos hijos. Nació y creció en el campo, donde su familia le enseñó todas las labores agrícolas y, gracias a ello hoy en día posee cultivos de maíz y fríjol, ubicados en unos terrenos prestados, los productos que cosecha los vende en el mercado, convirtiéndose esta en su principal fuente de ingresos, lo que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia. El cliente es un señor activo, pujante, emprendedor y diariamente lucha para velar por el bienestar de sus hijos y su esposa, pues ellos son su principal motivación para seguir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos, pues esta actividad es muy inestable e incierta. Esto lo lleva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (semillas, abonos, riegos, fertilizantes), que son necesarios para poder sacar la cosecha actual, preparar el terreno para sembrar nuevamente y así continuar con su labor. Francisco sueña con hacer crecer sus cultivos y hacer de su actividad un negocio más rentable, con el que pueda ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor.
texts.en: Francisco is 48 years old, married, and the father of two children.  He was born and raised in the country, where his family taught him how to perform all the farming tasks. Today, thanks to their teaching, he has corn and bean crops, located on rented land.  He sells the products he harvests at the market, making this his main source of income, which allows him to support his family.  The borrower is an active, vigorous, enterprising gentleman and strives daily to ensure the welfare of his wife and children because they are his main reason for forging ahead, and overcoming various obstacles as his business is very unstable and uncertain.  This leads him to seek the support of a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of farming inputs (seeds, manure, irrigation, and fertilizers) that he needs in order to be able to harvest the current crop, prepare the land for planting again, and continue with his work.  Francisco dreams of growing his crops and making his business more profitable so that he can offer his family better living conditions and enjoy the fruits of his arduous labor.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs (seeds, manure, irrigation, and fertilizers).

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo  sus tres hijos, ella es una mujer muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual su hija le ayuda a repartir las tortillas, sobre todo en los fines de semana. Ana desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  Ana is very responsible and her biggest priority to help her family to prosper.  Ana sells tortillas at lunchtime and in the evening.  She has her stall at her home, where her daughter helps her to distribute the tortillas, especially at the weekend.  Ana would very much like to be able to improve her business as it is providing her with stable profits which allow her to support her family.  So, Ana is applying for a loan to buy corn in bulk, and lime.  She will use this to make a larger number of tortillas, particularly at the weekend when demand increases due to many other tortilla stall being closed.  With more tortillas she Ana will be able to make higher profits, which will allow her to improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk, and lime.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to improve her living standards. Besides the poultry business, Alice is a tailor.

With the KSh 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Dolly is 33 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the earliest and most well-known communities in Liberia. She is married, and she dropped out of school. She has two children, ages 16 and 18, who are presently attending school and live at home. For four years now she has been selling rubber dishes (plates, cups, spoon, pans, etc.). She makes a lot of profit since she is the only one involved in this business and because she sells quality products in her community market. However, she is still facing a problem of not having enough income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. She plans to build a house for her children in years to come and to educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes

loans.name: Arina

texts.en:
Arina is 20 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia which is well-known in Liberia. She is single and has two children ages 7 months old and 7 years old. Only one is in school and they all live at home. Arina was unable to complete 9th grade. 

For the past 5 years she has been running a shop where she sells soft drinks, toothpaste, soap, batteries, etc. She started this business by selling on a market table and she learned this ways of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profits and it keeps her busy. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks, toothpaste, soap, batteries, etc. to increase her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, toothpaste, soap, batteries, etc. to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers to allow his coffee plants to reach maximum production and to pay the workers who prune plants and maintain shade at his plantation.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Don Margarito de 61 años de edad,  realizo estudios de educación básica a nivel de 3° grado, y se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida, ya que proviene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos y no continúo con sus estudios. De los cuatro hijos solamente  2 viven con él  y tienen 14 y 16 años, se dedican a ayudarle a la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas, comercialización  de ganado y cerdo. Su compañera de vida se dedica  a realizar oficios domésticos.

Dentro  de las actividades que realiza Don Margarito, manifiesta tener la experiencia de toda su vida en la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas, en la comercialización de animales  aproximadamente 20 años y es a la que con más fuerza se dedica;  ya que le deja mayores ganancias. Este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a su tío, él lo acompañaba a diversos tiangues del departamento y fue dejando  contactos con los que actualmente trabaja. 

El préstamo será utilizado  para la compra de una vaca lechera  y una mancuerna de cerdos, los mantendrá un par de semanas  y luego  los venderá  a un mejor postor,  para recuperar  el costo de alimentación de los animales  y  su ganancia.

Las expectativas de don Margarito, es incrementar  su unidad productiva (disponer de mas efectivo para comprar mas animales) y  enseñar  a sus hijos  todas las herramientas para salir adelante, ya que solamente estudiaron hasta 7° grado.
texts.en:
Margarito is 61 years old. He completed elementary school through the 3rd grade.  He has worked in agriculture all of his life.  He comes from a family of scarce financial resources and was not able to continue his education.  Of his 4 children only 2 live with him.  They are 14 and 16 years old and help him plant grains and crops, and sell cattle and pigs.  His wife is a homemaker.

Among Margarito's activities he has lifelong experience in planting basic grains and crops and selling animals  For approximately the last 20 years he has dedicated most of his efforts to the latter activity, since it is more profitable. He learned this work from his uncle.  He traveled with his uncle to livestock sales in the region and made contacts with whom he still works.

This loan will be used to purchase a milking cow and a pair of pigs.  He will keep them for a couple of weeks and then he will sell them to the highest bidder to recuperate the cost of feeding the animals and make a profit.

Margarito hopes to increase his productivity (have more money to purchase more animals) and teach his children all the tools they will need to be successful, since they only attended school through the 7th grade.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow and a pair of pigs.

loans.name: Jose Osman

texts.es: José, tiene 40 Años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus padres en una aldea de la comunidad de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Lleva muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura donde cultiva  piña, maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 30,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra para limpieza y poderle dar un buen mantenimiento a sus cultivos para mejorar la cosecha de piña y granos básicos. Comprar mas terreno para ampliar los cultivos y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: José is 40 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in a village in the community of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  He has worked in agriculture for many years, raising pineapple, corn, and beans.  He sells the crops in the local market.  He is requesting a loan for 30,000 Lempiras to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor to weed and care for his plants, in order to improve his pineapple and grain crops. He hopes to purchase more land to expand his crops and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor to weed and care for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay day laborers who help him with the mowing and pruning on his farm, and to purchase fertilizers to help increase his production.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a pork chicharon vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Josephine is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like pork skin, cooking oil, salt, etc. for her business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like pork skin, cooking oil, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct sales business in the Philippines. She sells personal collection products. 

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more products to sell to her customers. Judelyn has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Judelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y su hijo, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: This borrower lives in a family member's home with her husband and son.  She is very well-known in the area where she lives because she is very humble and very dedicated to her work.  She has never allowed herself to be defeated and has always gotten ahead, though with difficulty.  With effort and dedication, this borrower has a shop where she sells staple goods, such as basic grains, milk, eggs, rice, and more.  She is very dedicated to her work and obliging to her customers.  For this reason, customers come first to this borrower and prefer her because of the products that she offers.  The borrower has seen a need to stock up her shop a little more, due to an increase in demand.  She does not have the capital to do this and so is applying for a loan to buy more products such as basic grains, instant products, sweets, drinks, and more.  She trusts in God that the help that she is applying for will be granted and that she will no longer have to worry about taking home an income to support the household every day

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, sweets, drinks, and more.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, es una persona trabajadora y vive con su nieta. Ella, se dedica a crianza de aves de corral, cerdos y ganado; dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, lo desempeña con apoyo de su hijo.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar alimento para el ganado, como lo es: concentrado y profilácticos. Esta inversión le ayudara a producir más lácteos y con ello comercializar mucho más.  
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y aumentar la clientela.
texts.en: Maria is a hardworking person, and lives with her granddaughter.  She raises raising poultry, pigs, and livestock and has been engaged in this activity for 15 years.  Her son helps her with the business.  The loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase feed for the livestock such as concentrate and prophylactic antibiotics. This investment will help her produce more milk and sell much more.  Her dream is to expand her business and grow her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated  feed and prophylactic antibiotics.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is a married man who has been blessed with two school-going children. He lives in a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Onesmus has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and villagers. His greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. With the KSh 25,000 he wants to purchase charcoal for resale. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Igemar Williams

texts.en:
Igemar dreams of becoming a professional. To achieve his goal, Igemar has enrolled in the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés. He plans on graduating in September, 2017, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

With this loan, Igemar plans to purchase his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not purchased in order to save money. With them, Igemar hopes to be able to better understand his coursework. 

As the youngest of four, with one older sibling attending college already, Igemar is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Igemar's father works in the military, and his salary is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for his textbooks.

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en el municipio de Comayagua. Desde más joven se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café.  Tiene su propia finca de café. Esta producción la vende en la misma zona a intermediarios. El préstamo que solicita es el primer ciclo y es por 4,500 Lempiras con el cual va comprar abono para la finca de café y para protegerla de enfermedades y va sembrar otra parcela para ampliar la producción. Su meta es llegar a cultivar tres manzanas de terreno e ir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en: Carlos is 20 years old, single and lives with his mother in the town of Comayagua.  Carlos has been working in agriculture, growing corn, beans and coffee, since a very young age.  He has his own coffee plantation and sells his product locally to middle-men.  This is Carlos' first loan cycle and he is applying for 4500 Lempira, which he will use to buy manure for the coffee plantation and to protect the plants from diseases.  He will also plant more coffee so as to expand production.  Carlos' goal is to plant on another five or so acres of land and so continue to grow little by little.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertiliser for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Gbeh

texts.en: Gbeh is 48 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the earliest and most well-known communities in Liberia. She is a widow and has five children between the ages of 13 and 33. Only two of her children are presently in school and live at home. For the past eight years she has been selling palm oil and coconut oil in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money that she received from her mother. She learned the business from her mother as well. She makes a lot of profit. Most interestingly, she has learned different local languages. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil and coconut oil to expand her business. Her plans are to expand her business and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and coconut oil

loans.name: Noemy Carmen

texts.en:
Noemy dreams of becoming a professional. Noemy was accepted into the Universidad Mayor De San Simon, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording graduation fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. Often there are fees for earning your title in medicine before graduating. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Noemy currently works 40 hours a week as a medical assistant and earns $11 a day. Unfortunately, Noemy's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. 

Growing up, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of five, with two older siblings attending college already, Noemy is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó hace 2 años, con la ayuda de su hermana.  Trabaja sola desde las 9 am hasta las 5 pm y también recibe la ayuda de su mamá.  Es madre soltera y tiene un niño recién nacido.  Aspira en un futuro a tener su negocio en casa (bazar o tienda) y también mejorar su vivienda.  Al momento necesita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en: The client is from the Isla area in Guayaquil.  She started two years ago with help from her sister.  She works alone from 9:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m.  She also gets help from her mother.  She is a single mother with a newborn child.  In the future she aspires to have a business at home (variety business or store).  She also wants to improve her home.  She now needs the loan to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Haydee De Jesus

texts.es: Haydee de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella tiene un pequeño chalet donde vende refrescos, galletas, dulce y otras serie de productos; su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el parque que está cerca de su lugar de residencia,  a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. Ella busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su chalet como: refrescos, golosinas, aguas, etc.  Lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Haydee, age 47, lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter.  She has a small store where she sells soft drinks, cookies, candy, and a series of other products.  Her business is located in the park that is close to her house.  Through this business she has gotten her family ahead.

She is looking to improve her quality of life.  That is why she is requesting a loan to increase the variety of items at her store.  She will buy things like soft drinks, candy, and water, etc.  This will allow her to increase the profits from her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candy, cookies, sweets, and water, etc.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José Ramón, tiene 37 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Barbara. El tiene 12 años de experiencia en ebanistería la que adquirió donde trabajaba. Hace 8 meses que inicio su propio taller en su casa donde fabrica muebles de madera para cocina, comedor, sala, puertas, ventanas y otros. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 22,000 lempiras para comprar madera, tiner, pinturas, lijas etc. Para la fabricación de  muebles y satisfacer  a los clientes. Su meta es ampliar la cartera de clientes y aumentar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Ramón is 37 years old, married, has three children and lives in the municipality of Santa Barbara. He has 12 years of experience as a cabinet maker that he acquired where he used to work. Eight months ago he started his own shop in his house where he makes wooden furniture for the kitchen, living room, doors, windows, etc.

José Ramón is requesting a loan for 22,000 HNL to buy wood, thinner, paint, sandpaper etc. to make furniture and satisfy his customers. His goal is to increase his clientele and increase the revenues for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials like paint, thinner, baseboard, sandpaper, wood, etc. for the making of furniture.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is running a shop in the area of New Kru Town, where she lives. It is one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. Hawa has been running this business and  providing services to her community for the past eight years now. She makes lots of profit since she is the only one who is running a shop in her community that sells many items at a low price. She explains that her profits are used on house rent, food, school fees, and to improve her savings account. One problem she faces is the rainy season, which leads to slow buying. She started this business just by selling for her friends who lent her some money. Hawa has a 13-year-old child, who is in school and lives at home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sardines, corn-beef, juice, spaghetti, biscuits, etc. to expand her sales. Hawa is 29 years old and is a sixth-grade dropout. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, corn-beef, juice, spaghetti, biscuits, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Ngala

texts.en:
Ngala is a married man with three children, all of whom go to school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over 10 years, Ngala has operated a cereal business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. 

With the 40,000 KES, he wants to purchase stock of beans, rice and maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of beans, rice and maize for resale

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su casa propia. Sofía se dedica a la venta de verduras frescas de diversas variedades. Cuenta con un vehículo para el transporte y realiza su venta de manera ambulatoria en el mercado principal de la ciudad y en algunos casos por zonas alejadas de su localidad. Brinda una buena atención que le ha ayudado a ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes. Hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien se encarga de conducir la furgoneta mientras que ella atrae a los clientes con su potente voz. Lleva realizando esta actividad más de 1 año y le va muy bien. Le gusta este negocio pues genera el ingreso económico que necesita su familia y además porque se siente cómoda desarrollando una actividad laboral con la cual se siente una persona productiva ya que antes no podía conseguir un empleo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará verduras frescas como lechugas, tomate, papá, cebollas y otros.
texts.en:
Sofía, age 32, is married and has four children.  They live together comfortably in their own house.  Sofía sells diverse varieties of fresh vegetables.  She has a vehicle for transportation.  She sells in an itinerant manner at the main market in the city and, in some cases, she sells in outlying areas.  

She provides good service, which has helped her win over her customers.  She has support from her husband.  He drives the van while she attracts the customers with her powerful voice.  She has been doing this business activity for over one year, and it is going very well for her.

She likes this business because it generates income that the family needs.  She also likes it because she feels comfortable being engaged in a work activity with which she feels like a productive person.  Before that, she was not able to find employment.

She will now request 1,000 soles.  She is grateful to all of the people that make this loan possible so that she is able to firm up her plans.  She will use the requested loan to buy fresh vegetables like lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and others.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables like lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and others.

loans.name: Jose Candelario

texts.es: Don José de 63 años de edad es una persona responsable y emprendedora, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 16 años de edad, hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, que luego comercializa por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con esto logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como concentrado, vitaminas, etc. para sus pollos, con esto espera incrementar sus ganancias y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don José is 63 years old and a very responsible and enterprising person.  He lives in his own house with her wife and his 16 year old son.

For many years he has worked raising chickens to fatten them.  He later sells them at different markets near his residence.  Through this, he manages to cover some household expenses. 

Don José requests this loan to purchase supplies for his business like concentrate, vitamins, etc. for his chickens.  With this he hopes to increase his profits and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy concentrate, vitamins, etc. for his chickens

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is married and has four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past ten years, she has run a fish-selling business, operating out of her home. Most of her customers are neighbors and town dwellers. Her biggest  challenge is seasonality. She is requesting a loan to buy bundles of fish to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers which will help increase his production and pay for workers on his plantation.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is running a table in the area of New Kru Town, where she lives. It is one of the early community in Liberia that is well-known. Oretha has been running this business for the past seven years. She makes lots of profit, and her profits are use for house rent, feeding, and to improve her savings account. One problem she faces is the slow buying during the rainy season. Oretha started this business by selling from a wheelbarrow in her community since she lives close to the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks to expand her business. She has six children between the ages of 6 and 26; only four are in school and live at home. Oretha is 48 years old, and she is single. She did not attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her plan is to own a store.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for the past five years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to support their entire family. Bushra is a motivated mother of six and is responsible to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase spools of threads, rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, rubber bladders and leather covers to make footballs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy choppers, discs, and all the tools for the mill

loans.name: Merlín Arely

texts.es: Merlin vive en casa alquilada junto a su esposo quien trabaja de carpintero y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante por la diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Merlin está solicitando un crédito par al compra de mas mercadería como: blusas, camisas, ropa interior para damas y caballero, etc. para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, y así poder tener  mejores ganancias para tener con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Merlin lives in a house she rents with her husband who works as a carpenter, and her daughter.  She works selling clothing by walking to different neighborhoods near her place of residence.  

With the money she gains and with the help of her husband, they can cover some costs of their home. Merlin is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise like: blouses, shirts, undergarments for women and men, etc,. to continue with her business since that is her sole source of work.  

This way she can have better profits and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, undergarments for women and men, etc.

loans.name: Zonia Aida

texts.es: Zonia de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su nieto, ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; Zonia es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, quiere hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Zonia tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: Zonia, 58, lives in her own house with her grandson.  She owns a tortilla shop that’s quite well-known where she lives; she has many customers because she sells the best, hot tortillas and provides the quickest service in addition to really affordable prices.  Zonia’s an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.  She wants to make her business grow which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy corn at wholesale.  Zonia hopes that she’ll be able to provide economic security at home and a fulfilled life for her family this way.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Blanca Olivia

texts.es: Doña blanca de 30 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar junto con su esposo e hijos  ella se dedica a la venta pupusas desde hace mas de 10 años ella es muy conocida en la zona por trabajadora, amable y honesta, doña blanca solicita un crédito para  poder invertirlo  en la compra de ingredientes para seguir elaborando las pupusas como: quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, frijoles, tomates, repollos, etc. y así generar mayor ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca, 30, lives in a family member’s house with her husband and children.  She has been selling ‘pupusas’ [grilled corn cakes] for more than ten years and is very well-known in the zone for being hardworking, kind and honest.

Blanca’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients like string cheese, corn, fried pork, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. to continue making pupusas thus generating higher income and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, fried pork, corn, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Mia`ad Group

texts.en: This group is called Mia`ad and consists of four women. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Shama`a is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. She is 56 years old, married and has children. She sells clothing, shoes, and incense and is applying for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy pants, shirts, sweaters, shoes, incense etc. She started the business 17 years ago with help from her family. The business is important to her because it generates extra income. Her hopes for the future are that her child continues to thrive and that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, sweaters, shoes, incense, etc. for her business

loans.name: Cleo

texts.en: Cleo is 28 years old and lives in New Kru Town. She is single and stopped her education at ninth grade. For the past six years she has been running a table where she sells rice by the cup. She started this business with a little money that she received from her boyfriend, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is very happy with her business because she makes lots of profit and has learned different local languages from her customers. Cleo is requesting a loan to buy more rice by the bag to expand her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice by the bag to expand her business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 34-year-old vigorous married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of ribbons, zippers and elastic material to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She wishes to spend part of her income on improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of ribbons, zippers and elastic material.

loans.name: Durbelly

texts.es: Durbelly, a sus 36 años de edad es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Hace algún tiempo, por falta de oportunidades laborales, decidió montar un negocio para adquirir recursos económicos por cuenta propia y así poder ayudar a su esposo con el sustento familiar; inició una pequeña tienda en un sector de la ciudad donde tiene la ventaja de no poseer competencia cercana, por lo que hasta el momento ha dado buenos resultados y, de esta forma ha podido generar recursos para solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar. La cliente es una mujer pujante, luchadora, activa y emprendedora, manifiesta que le gusta su labor porque maneja su tiempo, genera ingresos y puede estar pendiente de su hogar. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (productos de aseo, mecato, galletería, confitería, productos de la canasta familiar), de esta manera podrá aumentar su inventario y ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, satisfaciendo sus necesidades y diversos gustos, esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende los ingresos que recibe. Durbelly sueña con hacer crecer y fortalecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en un minimercado, donde pueda generar empleo y le permita tener una estabilidad económica para garantizar un mejor bienestar a sus hijos y tener mejor calidad de vida en un futuro a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Durbelly, 36, is married and mother of two children.  Some time ago due to the lack of employment opportunities she decided to start her own business to earn income on her own and be able to help her husband support the family.  She opened a small store in a sector of the city where her advantage is not having any nearby competition.  To date, she’s had good results and has been able to generate income to cover basic household expenses.

She is a driven, hardworking, active and enterprising woman who states that she likes her work because she manages her own time, generates income and can watch over her home.

She’s asking for the loan now to buy stock merchandise at wholesale (cleaning supplies, packaged snacks, crackers and cookies, sweets and basic staple items) so that she can increase her inventory and offer more variety of goods to her customers meeting their needs and various tastes.  This will be reflected in higher sales and thus income earned.

Durbelly dreams with making he business grow and strengthen to become a minimarket where she can generate employment and have economic stability to guarantee better well-being for her children and to have better quality of life in the future in the medium run.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en: Nighat is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. By this time, she has become famous for sewing fine clothes and makes enough to contribute to the family income. But due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. Nighat is in her fifth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 36 años, está casada desde hace 11 años con José y junto a él tiene 3 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Karina se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y artículos de primera necesidad como cereales, arroz, pan, huevos, aceite, leche y otros. Compra sus productos al por mayor en el mercado principal de la ciudad obteniendo sus productos a precios cómodos lo cual le ayuda a obtener algunos centavos adicionales como ganancia. Tiene su bodega en un reducido espacio de su vivienda, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 3 años y desde que empezó siempre ha trabajado sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da independencia para realizar otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que siempre hay personas que solicitan algún producto al crédito y al momento establecido para pagarle, no lo hacen, por ese motivo prefiere vender ahora todo al contado. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, agradece a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de contar con un capital de negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, algunas verduras, huevos y leche ya que estos productos tienen mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Karina, 36, has been married to José for 11 years and they have three children together living with them in her own house.  Karina works selling groceries and basic staple items like cereals, rice, bread, eggs, oil, milk and others.  She buys her goods at wholesale in the city’s main market at good prices which helps her to earn a few cents more in profit.  

Her store is located in a cramped space at home.  She’s worked at this activity for the last three years and has worked alone since the beginning.  What she likes about her work is the freedom it gives her to do other things and what she dislikes is that there are always folks who ask for some product on credit and when the scheduled moment to pay comes they don’t do so; this is why she prefers to sell everything for cash now.

On this occasion she’s going to request 1,500 soles.  She thanks the people who provide her with the opportunity of having business capital to rely on and also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested loan to buy food items like rice, sugar, some vegetables, eggs and milk since these are the products in highest demand.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino, de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador. vive en compañía de su esposa Vicenta y sus hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres . Desde más de 30 años dedicó su tiempo y esfuerzo a la ganaderia y agricultura, comenta que desde niño comenzó a cuidar de la tierra por lo que según su propias palabras, “es lo único que sabe hacer”. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano comienza el día con el cuidado de sus animales a quienes alimenta y pasta en las grandes praderas de su pueblo, que se ubican a varias horas de distancia de su casa, por lo que llega al atardece a guardar a los animales para dormir. Durante ese día aprovecha el tiempo para cuidar de sus sembríos pues a esa actividad también se dedica Marino, “cuando los animales se encuentran maduros, comercializo los ejemplares en la feria que se realiza en la zona, los días viernes de cada semana”, comenta. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marino, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales, asimismo comprará ovejas, burros y toros con el resto de dinero.
texts.en:
Marino, 53, is a hardworking man living with his wife, Vicenta, and their children who he cares for in the house he inherited from his parents.  He’s dedicated his time and effort to agriculture and raising livestock for more than 30 years.    He comments that he started working the land when still a child and as he himself states: it’s the only thing he knows how to do.

He rises daily very early in the morning to start his day caring for his animals that he feeds and takes out to pasture in the big pastureland in town located several hours away from his house.  He returns at dusk and brings the animals in to sleep.  

He takes advantage of the day to care for his crops because this is another of Marino’s activities.  “When the animals are mature I sell them in the local livestock market that takes place every Friday,” he comments.  

This is his second Kiva loan and he’s grateful for the support provided because he’ll be able to continue investing in his business’ progress.  He also commits to be punctual with his payments.  Marino will use the 3,500 soles to buy balanced animal feed as well as to buy sheep, donkeys and bulls with the rest of the money.

loans.use: to buy sheep, burros, bulls and animal feed.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Don Carlos de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, él se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, se siente satisfecho y muy cómodo con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio y sus dos molinos ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his family.  He works at a mill, processing all types of food like corn, beans, flour, and salsas, among other things.
