They sell the harvested products at a good price. Because their income is seasonal and not enough for the family, Mtvarisa has decided to start her own business. She has sought credit from local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. This startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people and inexperienced entreprenneurs to get a loan for starting or re-starting a businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $1,200 to start a clothing business. She plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell it at higher retail prices. This will increase her income and allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin a clothing business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 56 años, vive al lado de su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de ropa de distintas marcas, modelos y tallas para todas las edades, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, así mismo ofrece al público la mejor calidad de sábanas y toallas en diversos colores. Toda su mercadería la renueva de manera mensual, para ello viaja a otra ciudad donde encuentra todo lo necesario a precios mas baratos. Trabaja en este sector desde hace 1 año y asegura que le genera mayor rentabilidad que sus anteriores actividades. Recibe el apoyo de su hijo y de su pareja quienes le ayudan a movilizar la mercadería pesada. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la facilidad que tiene de conseguir nuevos clientes, su carisma y su alegría le han permitido realizar buenas ventas en corto tiempo, por lo tanto el dinero que obtiene como ganancias económicas es generado con mayor rapidez. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa conformada por polos, shorts, pantalones, blusas y sábanas.
texts.en:
Maria, 56, lives with her husband and their son in their own home. Maria works by selling clothing of various brands, models, and sizes for all ages for both men and women. She also offers the best quality sheets and towels in diverse colors to the public. She renews her merchandise monthly. She travels to another city where she finds everything she needs at low prices. 

She has done this work for one year and indicates that it is more profitable than her previous jobs. She gets help from her son and husband, who help move the heavy merchandise. She likes how easy it is for her to meet new customers. Her charisma and happiness allow her to make good sales in a short amount of time. Therefore, the money she makes is earned more quickly. 

At this time, she is requesting 3,800 soles, for which she thanks everyone who makes this loan possible so she can continue her goals. Maria promises to make her monthly payments punctually. With this loan, she will buy wholesale clothing such as polos, shorts, pants, blouses, and sheets.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing such as polos, shorts, pants, blouses, and sheets

loans.name: Lulezim

texts.en:
Lulezim is a Roma man who has been selling fabric raw material for the past ten years in the city of his residence. Lulezim goes to Turkey to stock up on fabric to sell. He is requesting his first loan to stock up on raw material.

Many people of his community have been pursuing the same type of activity since the collapse of the communist regime and they have been successful at it.  They have been able to build good lives for their families. Albanians like to have their clothes custom made rather than buying them off the rack. One reason for this is that it is less expensive. The second reason is that under the previous regime there were no clothes in the stores so everyone would go to tailors to have them stitched. 

Lulezim has three young children who are ten, nine and seven years old and all of them attend school. They live in a main city in south central Albania.

loans.use: to stock up on fabric raw material.

loans.name: Brunilda

texts.en: Thanks to the support of her previous loan, Brunilda replaced their truck's engine. With this loan she and her husband want to finish all of the repairs on their truck. This truck is their business and so they beg for your kindness again.

loans.use: to finish repairing the truck they use for business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia  junto a su compañera de vida y  su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, es una persona humilde, trabajadora, honesta eficaz en sus labores y muy capaz de sacar a su familia adelante, sus cultivos los almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía,  son muy demandados en la zona donde reside, no posee experiencia crediticia, pero demuestra ser muy responsable,  gracias a sus labores ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, el cliente solicita un  crédito para poder invertirlo en el cultivo del maíz comprando  semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. para poder continuar con la producción, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower lives in his own home with his life partner and his child.  He is a farmer who has been cultivating corn for a number of years.  He is an unassuming, hardworking, and honest person who is efficient in his work and is very capable of providing for his family.  He stores his crops in the silos shown in the photograph; his crops are very much in demand in the area where he lives.  He has no credit experience, but he has shown himself to be very responsible.  Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to cover many of his family's expenses.  He is requesting a loan to invest in growing corn; he will purchase seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, and other supplies so that he can continue with his production, increase his income, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies

loans.name: Rophina

texts.en:
Rophina is married with six children and they live in a five bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. 

She has faced so many challenges in life including the death of family members, accidents in her family and sickness of her children.

She has taken and successfully repaid five previous loans.  With this new loan she will increase her farming activities by buying more farm seedlings such as yams, corn and coco yams. She will also pay laborers to farm the land and buy chicks, drinkers, feed, medication and farm seedlings. She is optimistic that her business will succeed because she has been doing the business for a long time. She has good farmland for the cultivation of the crops. She plans to buy good, improved chicks and she has a good site for keeping her chicks. With this loan she will be able to sell to her community at a cheaper rate and she will have the stock ready to meet the demand.

With the profit from this loan, she will expand her business activity, educate her children by paying their school fees and providing other school needs, and also provide for the welfare of her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and because members are educated before loan disbursal.

loans.use: to buy chicks, drinkers, feed, medication and farm seedlings and to clear farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a deep freezer and additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Nidia Liz

texts.es: La socia Nidia continúa con la venta de artesanía y con el negocio del restaurante.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar joyas, ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por ayudarla a desarrollarse ahora en ambas actividades, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. La socia Nidia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Nidia is continuing with her business selling handicrafts, and with her restaurant business.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy jewelry.  She is very grateful to the lenders for helping her to develop her two businesses.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Nidia beongs to the communal bank "Kukuli" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Majlinda

texts.en: Thanks to you all who financed Majlinda, she was able to build the stable and now she is in need for your help again to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, él posee una tienda desde hace varios años, es una persona humilde, educada, responsable, y muy dedicada sus labores además muy amble con sus clientes, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares. El cliente está solicitando un crédito para invertir en la compra de más productos para surtir su tienda como bebidas, galletas, dulces, golosinas, granos básicos, shampoo, papel higiénico, etc.  de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merece.
texts.en:
The borrower lives in his own house with his life partner and his son. He has had a store for several years. He is a humble, educated, and responsible person who is very dedicated to his work. Also, he is very friendly with his customers. Thanks to his job, he has managed to cover many of his household expenses. 

The borrower is requesting a loan to use for the purchase of more products to stock his store such as beverages, crackers, sweets, snacks, staple grains, shampoo, toilet paper, etc. This way, he can increase his income and give his family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy beverages, crackers, sweets, snacks, staple grains, shampoo, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Haron is a married man who supports a family of seven members.  

He rears livestock on his farm, and he has been in operation for three years, earning an income of KES 5,000 from selling milk.  He is now servicing his 7th term loan of KES 95,000 from KADET LTD.

Haron wishes to purchase more livestock for rearing.  The profits he gets will be kept for savings and also for the upkeep of his family members.

His dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for his farm

loans.name: Hala Group

texts.en:
The Hala group consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They work as hard as they can to offer a good life for their families. 

The group has taken out a loan of YER 230,000  from AMB.   Fakeha, the leader of this group, is a hard-working woman who lives in Sana`a. She said her husband is a lawyer who works hard but gets a low salary.

Fakeha is 36 years old and married, with five children. She is a housewife who assists her husband in trying to provide a better life and good education for their children.  

She intends to buy furnishings for her house, but she and her husband don`t have enough money.  So she has applied for a loan of YER 70,000  to buy a fridge for her house. She hopes to buy home appliances and furniture to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her house.

loans.name: Tendoh

texts.en:
He is married with three children and they live in a three bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life among which are death of family members, friends and other loved ones, inadequate capital to effectively manage his farmland and sickness in his family.

He has taken and successfully repaid his loans five times and says with the new loan requested, he will expand his farmland by buying improved rice seedlings, medicine for the seedlings, a bag of fertilizer and a truck for the transportation of the output to his compound. He is positive of his business succeeding because he has been doing the business for a long time and has experience, he has regular customers who buy his output, and the seedlings he plans to buy are improved seedlings and as such will lead to high yields. With this business activity, he will benefit from eating the rice harvested from the farm, he will also sell at low prices.

With the profit from this loan, he plans to educate his children, buy more farmlands, and cater for the well-being of his family. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seedlings, truck, and medicine

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en:
He is single and lives in a two bedroom house in the Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced some challenges in life among which are inadequate finances to start up a business of his own and support his needs, and the death of loved ones.  

With this loan he plans to invest by buying more motor spare parts. He believes the business will succeed because he has been doing it for a long time; the business is located at a good site, regular customers buy from him, and the business is very easy to manage. With this business activity, the community will benefit from moderate prices, and it will ease their movement from one place to another.

With the profit from this loan, he will cater for his needs, support education for family members and pay his rent. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy motor parts like brake pads, fan belt, hydraulics, ball joints

loans.name: Emilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Emilia continúa con su actividad comercial de venta de artesanías, principalmente de pinturas al oleo. Emilia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material de trabajo como por ejemplo  pinturas y pinceles, ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad artística, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. 

La socia Emilia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Borrower Emilia continues to sell artisan products, especially oil paintings.  On this occasion Emilia is applying for a loan in order to buy work material such as paint and paint brushes.  She is very grateful to Kiva investors for helping her to develop her art work and promises to make her repayments on time.

Emilia belongs to the "Kukuli" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy material such as paint and paint brushes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and married, and he and his wife are blessed with two children, ages 6 and 3 years.  He supports a family of five members.  

He is a farmer in Marigat, mainly producing watermelons, and he has practised this farming for more than 10 years, earning an income of KES 70,000.

He is now servicing his 8th term loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD.  He intends to use this amount to purchase watermelon seeds and also  insecticides.  The profits he earns from the melons will be used to expand his farm and diversify into other fruits.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Caracol Group

texts.es:
La señora Epifania vive en comunidad Cosolapa Caracol, ubicada cerca de la presa Miguel Alemán. La señora Epifania es  profesora, tiene 49 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos.

Debido a que el dinero que la señora Epifania gana como un profesora no es suficiente para mantener a sus hijos y para cubrir todas sus necesidades en casa, ella y su esposo decidieron invertir en la compra de un taxi y una camioneta pasajera. Su marido y sus hijos conducen el vehículo todos los días con el fin de recibir más ingresos para mantener a la familia.

Ellos brindan este servicio de pasajeras en la ruta de Cosolapa caracol a Tabaquera una zona donde hay poco transporte y ellos aprovechan para brindar el servicio y obtener un ingreso economico.
Con el préstamo solicitado a VisionFund, la señora Epifania puede invertir en piezas de repuesto para sus carros, así como el mantenimiento necesario. Se espera que con el mantenimiento, más clientes podrán frecuentar el taxi, con el tiempo le gustaría comprar otro taxi. La señora Epifania está muy agradecida por la confianza que ha recibido para tener acceso a un préstamo.

Epifania es integrante de un grupo llamado Caracol y los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Benita venta de dulces, 
Mari Cruz venta de antojitos, 
Rosa venta de refrescos ,
Lucia venta de pescado,
Yadira venta de ropa, 
Emma venta de abarrotes.

**Las señoras Celestina y Edith quisieron salir en la foto ya que eran parte de un ciclo anterior.
texts.en:
Epifania lives in the community of Cosolapa Caracol, located close to the Miguel Alemán dam. Epifania is 49 years old, and she is a teacher. She is the mother of three children.

The money that Epifania makes as a teacher isn't enough to support her children and pay for basic necessities at home. For that reason, she and her spouse decided to invest in the purchase of a taxi and passenger van. Her husband and their children drive the vehicle every day with the goal of getting more income to support the family.

They offer this passenger service on the route from Cosolapa Caracol to Tabaquera, an area where there is little transport. They take advantage of this to offer their services and earn income.

With the loan she is requesting from VisionFund, Epifania will be able to invest in spare parts for her cars, and also do necessary maintenance work. She hopes that, with this maintenance, more customers will be able to use the taxi. In time, Epifania would like to buy another taxi. She is very appreciative of the trust she has received to get access to a loan.

Epifania is a member of a group called Caracol and the other members of the group are:
Benita, who sells sweets,
Mari Cruz, who sells snacks,
Rosa, who sells soft drinks,
Lucia, who sells fish,
Yadira, who sells clothes,
Emma, who sells groceries.

Celestina and Edith wanted to be part of this photo because they were part of a previous loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her vehicles.

location.town: Cosolapa Caracol, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 32 years old, married to David, and blessed with 2 children aged 2.5 years and 3 months old. She supports a total family of 3 members. She runs a retail shop in Marigat town and has been in this business for a period of 4 years earning an income of KES 28,000.

This is her 8th term loan of KES 125,000 from KADET LTD and she intends to use this amount to purchase more stock of sugar, tea leaves, wheat flour, and other stock for resale. The profits she gets will act as savings for future developments and will also be used to build rentals.

Her dream is to excel in her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a deep freezer and open another branch of her business

loans.name: Antonio De Paz

texts.es: Antonio de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la agricultura, desde hace 30 años él se dedica a la siembra de caña de azúcar y a la venta de ganado, tiene mucha clientela porque sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios muy accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, antonio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder seguir llevando el pan diario a su casa.
texts.en: Antonio is 61 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and children, who help him in his agricultural work.  Antonio has been growing sugar cane and selling cattle for thirty years.  He has a lot of customers because his products are of very good quality and sold at affordable prices.  With his profits, Antonio is able to cover some household costs.  Antonio is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilisers, manure, herbicides, and other products, such as you can see in the photo.  With these products he will be able to continue sowing his crops.  This is his only source of income and with it he will be able to keep taking home his daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, herbicides, and other products.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 53 years old and married. He lives in a small village of Kvareli district with his wife and two children. His wife is a housekeeper and his daughter works as a saleslady at local market. His son is a physical worker and gets a small monthly income. 

Vazha is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 1.4 hectares of agricultural land, where melon and maize are grown. Vazha works hard and always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price.  

As the family has only seasonal income, he decided to start a new business and seek credit among local financial institutions.  His attempts were unsuccessful, though, because of his poor living conditions. 

The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses.  Vazha's application was approved under the framework of this program for a loan of US$ 2,600. With the credit he will start trading in fish and meat. He will purchase from wholesalers and then resell at higher prices. 

This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative will give Vazha chance to have financial stability and a regular monthly income.

loans.use: to begin trading in fish and meat

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 50 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is Married and has five children; two of them are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Geofrey has been working hard to manage his stationary business, which provides computer services and sells CDs. 

To help expand his business, Geofrey has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more computers for the business, which will help Geofrey generate greater profits and improve on the standard of living. 

Geofrey hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business more . 

Geofrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Geofrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more computers to help expand his business.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнора милая, добрая учительница в возрасте 46 лет. Она работает в сельской школе со своим мужем. Женаты они очень давно, и работают вместе столько же. У них маленький и уютный дом и двое воспитанных детей. Дети от семьи преподавателей должны быть такими. В свободное от школы время муж и жена ухаживают за скотом. Они выращивают крупнорогатый скот вот уже 19 лет. Гулнора с мужем собираются увеличить поголовье скота. Но к сожалению, зарплата учителя не хватит для осуществления этого намерения. По этой причине Гулнора запрашивает кредит для приобретения трех бычков и телят для развития бизнеса. Они надеются на поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulnara is a pleasant and kind-hearted schoolteacher, 46 years of age. She works in a rural school alongside her husband. They have been married and working together for a long time. They have a small cozy house. Their two children well brought up, as you would expect in a family of educators. In the time free from school, the spouses raise livestock. They have been raising cattle for some 19 years. Gulnara and her husband would like to increase their livestock headcount. Unfortunately, their schoolteachers’ salary is insufficient to realize this plan. This is why Gulnara is requesting a loan to buy three bulls and calves so as to develop her business further. She and her husband are hoping for your support. 
.

loans.use: to buy three bulls and calves in order to develop her livestock business.

loans.name: Raif

texts.en:
Raif paid off his previous loan and now he is requesting your financial help again. 

He is very appreciative to all lenders who assisted him the previous time.

loans.use: to stock up on used inventory items to resell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 45 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores con quienes vive en la casa de su madre. El trabajo de Vilma consiste en la venta de productos comestibles. Tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en la vereda de su casa en donde pone a la venta diversos artículos como arroz, sal, azúcar, aceite, huevos, diferentes verduras, tubérculos y condimentos. Trabaja en este oficio más de 2 años. Sus clientes principalmente son sus vecinos y familiares que viven en su zona. Le ayuda en la atención su hermana y su mamá. Complementa esta labor con el alquiler de 2 mototaxis propios y con la venta de ropa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es muy relajado ya que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo, en ocasiones compra todos los productos al por mayor y eso le permite mantener siempre abastecido su negocio. Algunas veces tuvo problemas cuando realizaba ventas al crédito ya que no le pagaban en el tiempo determinado, sin embargo aprendió de esas malas experiencias y ahora trabaja tranquila. Espera consolidar una tienda más amplia en donde ofrezca también artículos para el hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos comestibles como arroz, aceite, azúcar, huevos y leche.
texts.en:
Vilma is 45, married and has 4 children. These children, who are now older live with her in her mother's home. 

Vilma's work involves the sale of food products. She has a small stall on the sidewalk of her home. She sells various items such as rice, salt, sugar, oil, eggs, various vegetables, tubers and spices. She has been working in this business more than two years. Her customers are mainly her neighbors and relatives who live in the area. Her mother and sister help her to attend to her clients.
She compliments this work by renting 2 mototaxis that she owns and the sale of clothing. 
What she likes about her work is that it is very relaxed and does not require much effort, sometimes she buys all wholesale products which allows her to always keep her business well stocked. 

She has sometimes had problems when allowing her clients to purchase on credit because they did not pay in the determined time, however she learned from those bad experiences and now works in peace. She hopes to establish a larger store where she can also offer household items. 
She thanks all those who continue to believe in her so that she can request a new loan that will help her to grow her working capital. With this amount she will buy food products such as rice, oil, sugar, eggs and milk.

loans.use: purchase food products such as rice, oil, sugar, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un joven muy responsable, que está estudiando la carrera de derecho. Quiere poder ser un gran abogado que ayude a las demás personas.
Quiere aprender e ir creciendo en su conocimiento, ya que sabe que es la única forma de crecer. Sus padres son muy luchadores y son sus principales ejemplos.
El solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que es muy costoso y quiere poder cubrirlos. También agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Jose is a responsible young man who is studying for a law degree.  He wants to become a successful lawyer who helps other people.

Jose wants to learn and become more knowledgeable since this is the only way for him to grow.  His parents are very determined and have served as his primary role models.  The loan he is requesting will be invested in the expenses for his degree which are very costly.  Therefore, he wants to be able to cover them.  Jose is grateful for the opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to pay for his degree expenses.

loans.name: Al-Shfafia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Shfafia. It consists of four men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking members to provide for their families. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials). 

Tawfiq is 34 years old. He is a married man and has four children. He is an employee getting a low salary that is not enough to cover household expenses. He intends to apply for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances to use for his house. He hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use for his house.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo quien trabaja de agricultor y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, desde hace varios años don José posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia donde vende todo tipo de productos comestibles y no comestibles, posee una gran demanda ya que tiene muy bien surtida la tienda, con lo que gana logra cubrir los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, don José está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, huevos, shampoo, azúcar, etc. y así surtir aun más la tienda y obtener mejor ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose is 56 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and son, who works as a farmer and helps with the household expenses. 
For several years Jose has owned a store in his place of residence, which sells all kinds of food products and other items. 
He shop is very popular as it is very well stocked. With what he makes he is able to cover the expenses that come up in his home. 
José is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic grains, oil, candy, soda, eggs, shampoo, and sugar so as to further supply the store and make the best profit to provide the best for his family.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, oil, candy, soda, eggs, shampoo, sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, cassavas, oil, corn, vegetables, meat, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier  es separado, tiene dos hijas, vive en casa de familiares ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario. El trabaja de chofer (independiente), no vive con sus hijas pero les pasa una asisitencia familiar voluntaria (mensual)  
 El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad compra (llantas y arreglo de rodamientos)
Sueño de Javier es que su movilidad este en buenas condiciones y poder tener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Javier is separated from his spouse and has two daughters.  He lives at the home of relatives in the city of El Alto.

Javier completed school through the secondary level.  He works as an independent driver.  His daughters do not live with him, but he voluntary provides them with monthly assistance.  The loan he is requesting will be used to maintain his vehicle.  He will buy tires and repair the bearings.  

Javier dreams that his vehicle remains in good condition so that he can earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and repairs.

loans.name: Hannah's Group

texts.en:
Hannah lives in the city of Accra-Dansoman. She is 52 years old and is a widow with three adult daughters.  

She has been in the clothes trading business for twelve years. She sells women's clothes and underwear. She works in a container shop in front of where she lives, and it is close to the main road where many people pass to their various destinations. 

Hannah decided to enlarge her trading and to increase her potential profit because she needs money to complete her housing project. This is the twelfth deal with ID-Ghana for Hannah, and she is very appreciative of the past cooperation. She is very hopeful that Kiva lenders will support her.

Hannah is asking for a loan of GHS 3,000 to buy two bales of clothes and underwear to sell to customers. She hopes that the season's sales will be very profitable, and she has very good repayment records. The other partner is Esther who sell wax prints, and they need a total amount of GHS 3,500 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothes and underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio continúa con su actividad económica que es la venta de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante, él está trabajando muy duro para sacarlo adelante y haciéndolo crecer cada vez más. El señor Julio está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  mobiliario como mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina para realizar mejoras en su local. El señor Julio está muy agradecido con los inversionistas por ayudarlo en su actividad económica y en la educación de sus hijos para procurarse un mejor futuro. 

El señor Julio pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Julio continues with his business of selling food, as he has a small restaurant. He is working very hard to get himself ahead and continue growing more and more. 

Julio is requesting this loan in order to buy furnishings like tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils to make improvements on his restaurant. Julio is very grateful to the investors for helping him with his work and his children’s education to secure a better future. 

Julio belongs to the communal bank “Kukuli” in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to purchase furnishings like tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank and firewood.

loans.name: Balikuddembe Kigenya Group

texts.en:
Kigenya is located on a busy road of Mutukula-Masaka as has members dealing in several activities like shopkeeping, timber and farming. These members include Fred, Margret, Mary, Mbanga, Siraje, Margret and Charles.

Margret is a divorcee, aged 27, and a mother of two, of whom one child goes to school. Her  business is a retail shop, and she works seven days a week and 13 hours each day. She will use the loan to buy household items for sale in the retail shop.

She started her business in 2006 because it seemed well earning. Her clients come from the area and include passersby. The major challenge with her business is an unending list of debtors. She is going to use the loan for increasing the stock.

Her future hope is to buy a plot and build herself and her family a residential house. 

Her word to lenders is to understand their clients, especially when they have an explanation for their failure to pay. The man kneeling is a group member who is still saving and hopes to get a loan in the next cycle. He signed the waiver form, though. The lady standing behind is a Ugafode staff member.

loans.use: To buy household items to sell.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher has been a single mother for five years, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly parents). Her business is a retail store, and she has had this business for six years.

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and jerrycans of cooking oil. Janepher works in a shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing cost of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully-stocked retail shop and also to become a wholesaler. 

Janepher resides in a rented house and she and her family have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 5 years selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She generates additional income through tailoring and working at the market. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to get enough plots and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Akhmeta district with her son and daughter-in-law who are students. Nana graduated from pedagogical college and works as a teacher at the local public school. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start a husbandry business but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $3700, Nana will purchase a milking cow and a pig. She will also purchase building materials and build a cattle shed. Nana will produce dairy products to sell and she will generate more income. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow and a pig, and build a cattle shed

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 27 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with two children aged five and seven. Mario has been farming rice to support his family for five years now. He works hard in his farm in order to produce a better yield. He is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy fertilizer for his farm. Mario knows that a good harvest could also be attributed to fertilizer and the loan will be such a big help for his farming business. 

His income will then be used for his family's food consumption and school fees of his children.

In the future, he hopes to have a bigger farm to manage and to become sustainable in his business.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She has a business selling snacks. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal and beef.  She has been in this business for 5 years selling to all categories of people on a retail basis seven days out of every week.  She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. Her major business challenges include transportation of bags of Irish potatoes and charcoal and the ever-increasing price of cooking oil. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant selling snacks and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal and beef.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 51 años, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes estudian actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de fresco de diferentes sabores desde hace 10 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, obtiene muy buen nivel de ventas,  ya que  se encuentra en un muy buen lugar de ubicación, y muy buscada por sus clientes gracias a la calidad con que prepara sus productos y la amabilidad con que los atiende a sus clientes, doña María solicita un crédito para la compra de productos a si como insumos para el negocio como frutas, azucar, leche, etc.para poder aumentar sus ganancias y poder ofrecerle a su familia un mejor futuro económico.
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old and lives in her own house together with her husband and their two children who go to school. She has been selling soft drinks of different flavors for ten years. Her business is located in her home. Her sales are high since the place is very well located, and many people come to her because of the high quality of her products and her kind way clients. Maria is applying for a loan in order to buy inputs for her business such as fruits, sugar, milk, etc. so that she can increase her profits and offer her family a better economic future.

loans.use: to buy fruits, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su hijo y su compañero de vida quien es empleado de una empresa privada, Ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años, es una persona amble, responsable, y muy dedica a su trabajo, su tienda es muy demanda en la zona gracias a la calidad de sus productos, tiene un buen nivel de ventas, de esta manera y con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Rosa solicita un crédito para comprar más producto para surtir su tienda como: granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, jabón, detergentes, refrescos, golosinas, etc. y si obtener mayores ingresos y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and lives in her own home together with her son and her life partner, who is employed with a private company. Rosa has had a store for many years. She is friendly, responsible and very dedicated to her work. Her store is very much in demand in her area thanks to the quality of her products. She makes a good amount of sales and with this and the help of her husband, she is able to meet many of the household costs. 

Rosa is applying for a loan to buy more products to re-stock her store such as pulses, oil, sugar, soap, detergent, soft drinks, lollies, etc. With this she will be able to make a better income and give her family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy pulses, oil, sugar, soap, detergent, soft drinks, lollies, etc.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Doña Marlene de 51 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida,  y sus tres hijos, Ella posee un chalet donde vende pupusas y bebidas y también se dedica a la venta de ropa,  su negocio está ubicado en muy buena zona de comercio, por esta razón ya posee una clientela establecida, que prefiere sus productos, es una  persona con muy buenas referencias personales, además responsable y honesta, de esta manera y con la ayuda ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Marlene Solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería e ingredientes para su negocio, como bebidas, agua, maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, tomates, etc. para poder incrementar su nivel de ventas y darle a su familia un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Marlene is 51 years old and lives in her own house together with her life partner and their three children. She runs a food stall where she sells stuffed corn tortillas and drinks, and she also sells clothes. Her business is located in a commercial area, and therefore she has an established clientele with a preference for her products. 

She is a person with good personal references, responsible and honest, and this is how she has been able to pay for many of the family's expenses. Marlene is applying for this loan in order to buy more merchandise and ingredients for her business, such as soft drinks, water, corn, beans, fried pork rind, cheese, tomatoes, etc. so that she can increase her sales and offer her family a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, corn, beans, fried pork rind, cheese, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Vivian Rocio

texts.es: Vivian de 33 años vive en casa de un familiar junto a sus dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, ella posee una tienda desde hace tres años, refleja ser una persona puntual con los pagos, amable y muy dedica a las labores que desempeña en su negocio, su tienda es muy demandada ya que la zona es muy transita por personas, esto la hace muy buena para el comercio, volviéndose una ventaja para obtener mayores ingresos, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos gastos familiares, Vivian solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como bebidas, sopas, granos básicos, golosinas,  etc. Para poder incrementar su nivel de ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vivian is 33 and lives in her relatives' home with her two sons who are 8 and 5 years of age. Vivian has had a store for three years and has shown herself to be punctual with her repayments, friendly and very dedicated to the work she carries out in her business. Her store is very much in demand since it is in an area that sees a lot of people, which is very good for business and has proved to be an advantage in obtaining a better income. With this business Vivian has been able to meet many of the household costs.

Vivian is applying for a loan to purchase more goods such as drinks, soups, pulses, lollies, etc. to increase her sales and improve her and her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy drinks, soups, pulses, lollies, etc.

loans.name: Ep Jiwe Group

texts.fr: Le client  Furaha  est leader du collectif d’affaire des enseignants, âgé de 38 ans, marié et  père de 3 enfants dont un en âge de scolarité. Le client est un jeune enseignant. Il est confortable avec son métier. Il l’exerce avec zèle et abnégation. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira  de finaliser le contrat d’achat de la parcelle  et démarrer avec son projet de construction d’une maison. Dans le futur, il souhaite renouveler son prêt auprès de Hekima pour ouvrir une boutique. Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima d’avoir pensé aux enseignants.
texts.en:
Furaha is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 38 years old, married, and a father of three school-aged children. Furaha is a young teacher, who enjoys his job and works diligently and selflessly.

This new loan will help him finalize a contract to buy a piece of land and start his project of building a house. 

In the future, he wishes to renew his loan with Hekima in order to open a shop. 

Finally, Furaha strongly thanks Hekima for supporting teachers.

loans.use: to finalize the purchase of a piece of land and start building a house

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru:
Комил в настоящее время занимается животноводством. Ему 49 лет, он из района Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Комил женат и имеет сыновей в возрасте от 16 до 22-х лет. Недавно ему друг предложил работать с ним оператором, так как количество его клиентов увеличилось и он хочет передать ему часть клиентов. Комил работал оператором давно и у него 10 летний стаж. Он снимал свадьбы, дни рождении, банкеты и т.д. и он выполнял работу красиво и качественно. Чтобы снова приступить к делу Комил просит кредит для приобретения современной профессиональной камеры. Благодаря его другу и кредиту он снова сможет заниматься своим любимым и давним делом. 
У Комила большие планы на будущее. Он планирует открыть в будущем большую студию.
texts.en:
Komil is presently a livestock farmer from the city of Khuljand; from the same part of the city as B. Gafurov.  He is 49 years old, married, and has sons ranging from 16 to 22 years of age.  Not long ago, a friend of Komil's suggested he work with him as a cameraman, as their client base has increased, and he wants Komil to take on some of the clients.  Komil worked as a cameraman some time ago, and has 10 years of experience as one.  He would film weddings, birthdays, banquets, and the like, and would always produce beautiful, high-quality work. 

To get the ball rolling with his re-entry into the business, Komil is requesting a loan so he can buy a modern, professional-quality camera.  He has big plans for the future; for one, he plans on founding his own film studio.  Thanks to his friend and this loan, he will once again be able do what he loves for a living, as he had been so many years ago.

loans.use: to buy a professional video camera

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
El señor Jhon continúa con su actividad económica que es la comercialización de productos de artesanía, pero también y paralelamente sigue con el servicio de taxi, esto para ayudarse económicamente y percibir un ingreso monetario extra. El señor Jhon está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como chompas, chulos, guantes  de lana.

El señor Jhon está muy agradecido con los inversionistas por ayudarlo en su actividad económica y en la educación de sus hijos para procurarse un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jhon continues to work selling handcrafted products but at the same time he is also running a taxi service which is helping him financially and providing him with extra income.

Jhon is applying for a loan to buy goods such as jumpers, beanies and woollen gloves. He is very grateful to the investors for helping him with his business and the education of his children so that he may create a better future for them.

loans.use: to buy goods such as jumpers, beanies and woollen gloves

loans.name: Juan Raul

texts.es:
El socio Juan Raul continúa con su actividad económica que es la comercialización de elementos de artesanía como ropa de fibra de alpaca, joyería y adornos en cerámica.

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como tejidos, joyas en plata y adornos en cerámica para su actividad comercial artesanal. El pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Group member Juan Raul continues to work selling handcrafts such as clothing made from alpaca fibre, jewellery and ceramic ornaments. 

At the moment he needs a loan to purchase knitted goods, silver jewellery and ceramic ornaments for his business selling handcrafts. He is a member of the Kukuli community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy knitted goods, silver jewellery and ceramic ornaments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 800 kilograms of cassava

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: La señora Rita  continúa con su actividad comercial artesanal, en la producción y venta de pinturas al oleo, ella en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material de trabajo como pinturas, tela para lienzos, pinceles y marquetería pues son necesario para la elaboración de sus lienzos artísticos, ella  está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Rita continues to work selling handcrafts and making and selling oil paintings. At the moment she is applying for a loan to buy art supplies such as paint, fabric for canvases, paint brushes and maquetry which she needs to create her paintings. 

Rita is very grateful to the investors for helping her to continue with her work and she promises to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy art supplies such as paint, fabric for canvases, paint brushes and maquetry.

loans.name: Bwayi Group

texts.fr:
Rucie  fait partie du groupe  Bwayi  et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle est mariée à Gérard, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de  5 mois  à 3 ans. 

Elle  fait le commerce de jus de banane depuis 3 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour les transformer en jus, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter  un terrain  cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rucie is a member of the Bwayi group and lives in Cibitoke. She is married to Gerard, a tailor. Together they have two children, ages five months and three years. 

Rucie has been selling banana juice for three years. This is her first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of bananas, which she will make into juice and resell to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy some farmland and see her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas to make into juice and resell

loans.name: Oroberesoromandi Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIORA représente le groupe OROBERESOROMANDI. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a30ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 01 va à l’école. 
Mme fait la poterie depuis 40ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Tougan au Burkina. Ses clients sont les vendeurs en gros et détails (hommes et femmes).
Elle veut s’acheter 20charettes d’argile.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safiora represents the Oroberesoromandi group. She is going well. Married, she is a mother of five children. The eldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 18 years old. One child is in school. 

Safiora has been making pottery for 40 years. She procures her goods in Tougan. Her customers are wholesalers and retailers (men and women). 

[With her loan], she wants to buy 20 cartloads of clay.

Safiora will reinvest her profits into her business. She aims to expand the scope of her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 cartloads of clay

loans.name: Jose Leandro

texts.es: José, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea de la Campa, Lempira. trabajo por varios años como jornalero y hace 8 años el ha logrado tener su propio cultivo de café. Ahora saca sus cosechas y las vende en el mercado local para obtener ingresos. el cultivo lo tiene en una aldea cercana donde vive. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado que es por 18,000 Lempiras, va comprar fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a la finca de café. Su objetivo es poder sacar mejor producción para la venta. Con las ganancias piensa hacerle mejoras a su vivienda y sembrar otra área de terreno.
texts.en:
José, 30, is married with four children and lives in the small village of la Campa, Lempira.  He has worked for many years as a labourer and eight years ago he managed to obtain his own crop of coffee. Now he harvests his crop and sells it at the local market to obtain a better income. His crop is located in a small village near his home. 

José has applied for a loan of 18,000 lempiras to buy fertiliser to maintain his coffee plot. His goal is to yield a greater crop to sell and with these earnings he plans to make improvements to his home and sow another plot of land.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser to grow coffee

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Catherine est une jeune camerounaise de 34 ans. mariée et mère de 04 enfants donc le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé 03 ans, elle possède une mini alimentation dans un quartier de la ville ou elle vends les produits de première nécessité. ne disposant pas d'un stock assez consistant de marchandises, Catherine souhaite avec l'argent du crédit acheter: les cartons d'huile raffinée, de pâtes alimentaires, savons. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinjectés dans l'activité et permettront également à Catherine d'assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Catherine is a young 34-year-old Cameroonian. She is married and a mother of four children, of whom the oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is three years old. 

Catherine owns a food kiosk in a part of the city, where she sells basic goods. 

Catherine does not have a consistent flow of stock, so she would like to buy some cartons of refined oil, pasta, and soap with her loan.

Earnings will be put back into her business and will also allow her to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic goods

loans.name: Yony

texts.es: La señora Yony continúa con el negocio de compra y venta de artesanías,  principalmente de elementos decorativos como imaginería en telas y tejidos y los comercializa en su propio establecimiento y también a los diferentes mercados artesanales de la ciudad. La señora Yony en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como telas e hilos.
texts.en:
Yony continues to buy and sell handcrafts, mainly decorative pieces such as embroidery on fabric and woven goods which she sells in her own premises as well as in the different craft markets in the city. 

At the moment Yony is applying for a loan to buy materials such as fabric and thread.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric and thread

loans.name: María José  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José está formado por 12 mujeres que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este banco el cual les ha ayudado mucho, ellas  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo, se dedican en su mayoría al comercio informal.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Martha, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 8 años, la mayor  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo se  dedica al comercio.

Doña Martha al ver que su esposo no gana mucho en la agricultura recogió todos sus ahorros que tenia y con ayuda de uno de los créditos que recibió del banco comunal empezó un negocio de venta de útiles escolares y papelería en su casa,  su negocio es muy bueno ya que su casa queda muy cerca de un colegio y con esto sus ventas son muy garantizadas, hace poco también empezó con un negocio de venta de ceviches de pescado y ciertas golosinas con lo cual sus ganancias han mejorado y esto gracias a los créditos que ha recibido, tiene 6 años con este negocio el cual les ayuda a salir adelante y mejorar su vida.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar útiles escolares y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su meta es seguir mejorando sus negocios.
texts.en:
The María José community bank is made up of 12 women who decided to get together a while ago to create the bank, which has helped them a lot. They meet every fortnight in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, an area which is known for being a business district as well as hosting the traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, but most of all the city is used for informal commerce.

Martha is one of the group members. She is 35 years old, married and has two children with her husband who are 17 and 8. The older one is in high school and the younger one goes to primary school. Her husband is a business man.

Seeing that her husband was not earning much in agriculture, Martha gathered all her savings and with the help of a loan she received from the community bank she began a business selling school supplies and stationery from her home. Her business is going very well as her home is very close to the high school so she has guaranteed sales. A little while ago she began selling fish ceviche and some lollies which have increased her earnings. Thanks to the loans that she has received she has now been running this business for six years, which has helped her to keep moving forward and improve her life. 

This loan will go towards buying school supplies and groceries to prepare meals. She has been with the community bank since its inception and she likes it because she was able to start her business with a loan she received from them. 

Her goal is to continue to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and groceries

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: La señora María Virginia continua con la venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos en general y perfumería, productos que distribuye de forma directa y a solicitud, a sus clientes que en su mayoría son público femenino. María Virginia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cosméticos y perfumes, ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas  por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
María Virginia continues to sell beauty products including cosmetics and perfume. She sells them face to face and by order form to her customers who are mainly female. 

At the moment María Virginia is applying for a loan to buy goods such as cosmetics and perfume. She is very grateful to the investors for helping her to continue working and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy goods such as cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Ana Mabel

texts.es: Ana, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Estuvo trabajando varios años en una maquila y luego quedo sin empleo y decidió establecer su propio negocio el cual es una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como azúcar, pan, refrescos, churros, golosinas, manteca, pastas, carnes, especies etc. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 8 meses y necesita surtirlo, por eso  ha solicitado un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, leche, pan, refrescos, azúcar, golosinas etc.
texts.en:
Ana is 30, married with two children and lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. She worked in a factory for many years and then she became unemployed, so she decided to set up her own business running a grocery store where she sells goods such as sugar, bread, soft drink, churros, lollies, butter, pasta, meat, spices, etc.

Ana has had this store for eight months and she needs to re-stock it, which is why she has applied for a loan of 7,000 lempiras to buy pulses, butter, soft drink, milk, bread, sugar, lollies, etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as pulses, butter, soft drink, milk, bread, sugar, lollies, etc. to re-stock her store

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La socia María Luisa continúa con la compra y venta de artesanías de tipo de plata y cerámica.  En esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como joyería en plata y adornos cerámicos. La socia María Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: María Luisa continues to buy and sell silver and ceramic crafts. On this occasion, she is seeking the loan to buy merchandise such as silver jewelry and ceramic ornaments. María Luisa belongs to the Kukuli communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú. She is grateful for and appreciates the loan, and she promises to meet the monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as silver jewelry and ceramic ornaments.

loans.name: Elizabeth Ama

texts.en:
After graduating from Junior High School, Elizabeth Ama decided to set up her own hair dress shop (beauty salon) business in Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). With over a year's-worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more hair products to expand her business. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a kenta weaver) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more hair products to expand her business.

loans.name: Campamento Group

texts.en:
The rural community of Momostenango is located in the western highlands of Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Camapamento” meaning “camp” is located here. The group is composed of ten dynamic women who are committed to leaving poverty behind and leading empowered lives.

The women of the Trust Bank are involved with agriculture as well as the production of handicrafts. Calixta is a 20-year-old member of the group who is married with two little boys who are the light of her eyes. Her business is animal husbandry which she was attracted to four years ago. She reports that it was difficult to raise animals as she did not have the necessary funds to do so properly. Calixta was greatly heartened to find Friendship Bridge and joined the “Campamento” Trust Bank. She is currently starting her second loan cycle. Calixta will use her loan to purchase at least two pigs, a dozen chickens, turkeys as well as food to fatten them quickly. In this way, she will be able to provide a steady income which will serve the many needs of the family. In addition, she wants to begin saving money for the education of her sons.

Calixta is quite excited that her business is growing. Currently, she has 42 animals, including turkeys, pigs and many chickens. "My animals are well fed and people already know the quality of the product I sell so my animals are sold quickly when I go to the market. I also sell my animals from home taking out the transportation costs as my neighbors know me already.”

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Campamento” feels proud to belong to the KIVA and Friendship Bridge alliance. The women realize that with their educational trainings, careful planning and hard work, they can empower themselves and their family members leading all to a brighter and more successful future!

loans.use: To purchase two pigs, a dozen chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Jovina

texts.en:
Jovina is 25 years old and is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two children ages one and three. Jovina's husband is a farmer while she works at home raising hogs while looking after her small children. Jovina has been in the business of hog-raising for a year now. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets that she can raise to get a bigger income. 

Any profit will be for her children's healthy diet and family consumption. 

In the future, like most mothers, Jovina hopes to send her children to school for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 6 hijos, reside en la aldea Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura produciendo maíz y frijoles. Hace 15 años decidió por cultivar café el cual lo vende en grano en la misma zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en limpieza y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento al cultivo. Espera lograr buenas cosechas en esta temporada. Su meta es aumentar la producción y sus ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en: Roberto is 43 years old, he lives in a common law marriage with his wife with whom he has 6 children. He lives in the Nueva Frontera village of Santa Bárbara. He has always made his living in agriculture by producing corn and beans. Fifteen years ago, he decided to start growing coffee which he sells in grains in the same area. The loan that he is seeking is for 6,000 Honduran Lempiras that he will invest in cleaning and fertilizers to maintain the crop. He hopes to have good crops this season. Roberto's aim is to increase production and his income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in cleaning and the purchase of fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 51-year-old woman from the municipality of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with seven children. For 20 years now, she has been engaged in selling banana, taro, cassava and yam earning her an average of 3,000 PHP. Julita works hard for her family, specially to support her children who are still in college.

She is asking for a loan to buy more supply of banana, taro, cassava and yam. Her income helps in providing the basic needs of her family like food and school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to see her children successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy banana, taro, cassava and yam.

loans.name: Buganvilias Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Buganvilias”, was formed five years ago in a rural area of Cantel Quetzaltenango in the western highlands of Guatemala. The group is composed of eight members who will gratefully receive micro-loans for their productive activities.

Juliana is a 40-year-old married woman with six children who range from eight to twenty years of age. Each one of them attends school and the oldest daughter is in college. Juliana is thrilled with their educational progress. Juliana works in the textile industry and manufactures beautiful, traditional Guatemalan blouses called “huipiles” (pronounced “wee-peeles) from various villages including her own. She also makes the pretty, adorned aprons that the women wear as part of their daily attire. Juliana not only manufactures and sells her products in her usual venue but also takes special orders as well which she delivers every eight days.

Juliana’s business is progressing well and looking toward the future, she realizes that she needs to keep injecting financial capital to it. For that reason, she is applying for her 3rd loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and is requesting a loan of US$720. She will use the funds to buy different kinds of fabrics, yarns, and beads to decorate the huipiles. Juliana is excited at this opportunity to as it will allow her to sustain and grow the business. The income generated will be used to provide a better quality of life for the family including opportunities for improved healthcare and education. One of the biggest achievements that Juliana has achieved is having her 20-year-old daughter in law school. Juliana and her husband are making it a priority to keep each of their six children in school as they are aware that this is a real key to a more successful future for them. Juliana only attended school through the sixth grade as her parents thought that was enough time for her.

Juliana is the Secretary and Member of the Board of Directors of the “Buganvilias” Trust Bank. She, along with the rest of the members of the group, are most excited to receive new loans. Many of the ladies are involved in textile production and will use their loans to sustain and improve their business. They are most grateful for this opportunity and look forward to a more successful future for themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fabrics, yarns, and beads.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson operates a successful Zoona mobile money transfer business. He is very excited to be taking out his third Kiva loan. From the time he received his first loan in 2012, Edson’s business has grown significantly. He has purchased additional equipment like a trading booth to better serve his customers.  With his working capital loans, he has been able to offer additional services to his customer base such as mobile airtime. He also opened another outlet in his hometown of Chililabombwe. He says all this growth would not have been possible without the working capital assistance from Kiva lenders.

Now, Edson is requesting his third loan so he can increase his floating capital at his two shops. He explains that the business of mobile money transfers is one that requires a lot of money on hand because as the business grows, the number of customers also increases; hence, the need for more money to serve the growing customer base. This loan will help him reach more customers and scale his business even further.  

This picture was taken at Edson’s new trading booth.

loans.use: To increase his floating capital at his two shops so that he can grow his mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a young Tlaxcalan farmer continuing the family tradition. He and his family have grown crops and raised animals on the Tlaxcalan high plains for as long as they can remember, and for Felipe, the way of life still represents his principal source of income. 

As a young innovator, Felipe is looking to take advantage of technology to improve his production. With his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Felipe will be able to improve his yields, reduce the need to purchase expensive and damaging fossil fuels, and reduce the environmental impact of his farm. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Manyama Development Group

texts.en:
Manyama Development Group is located in a rural area of Rakai district. It comprises of nine members both men and women. These are responsible members dealing in different activities such as agricultural produce trading, bark cloth making, and passion fruit growing and selling. Harriet is married and a mother of five children aged between 14-20 years; all of whom attend school. She also takes care of five orphans who live with her. Her business is commercial farming where she rears pigs and cows. She started her business in 1998 to get money to meet her family's basic needs. Harriet’s clients come from the surrounding area.

She is going to use the loan for many purposes such as buying grains, as she prepares for the forthcoming season, and buying chicks to rear. Her hope for the future is to expand her business and to buy herself a car to ease the transportation of the produce if she continues getting loan facilities.

loans.use: to buy grain and chicks for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a 30-year-old determined farmer who started farming in 2003 with a hope of getting a clear source of income that would help him cater to his family's needs. He is married and has two children aged six and three years old. He gives the farming business, which is his sole source of income, an average of six hours each day. His farm is located in a local area in Katunda Parish-Mitooma Sub County. He would like to use the loan money, 700,000 UGX, to buy construction materials to finish his incomplete residential house that has stalled over time due to limited resources. His family will enjoy a decent accommodation when its complete. He will pay the loan using money from his banana plantation. His customers are traders from the same area. He says he is mainly faced with a challenge of Banana Bacterial Wilt, but believes that it will be solved with time and he will hence have financial stability.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building his house.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 45-years-old and married with four children ages six to 20. Magnolia has been engaged in retail business for six years now. She is into selling coconut wine, gasoline, rice, women's accessories, and barbecue ingredients. She is also into a key duplication business. Magnolia is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy coconut wine, gasoline, rice and barbecue ingredients. 

Magnolia works hard for her children. She hopes to make her business more sustainable and to educate her children successfully until college. In the future, Magnolia dreams of expanding her business for her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine, gasoline, rice and barbecue ingredients for her retail shop.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is a 54-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her youngest is 19 years old. Basilisa farms rice for a living while her husband works as a driver. She has been in the business of farming rice for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm.

Any income that she will generate from her business will provide food for her family and help pay for her children's school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to see her children living a successful life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Shelly

texts.en:
Shelly is excited to be taking out her second loan. With this loan Shelly plans to purchase a laptop to help expedite her service to customers and increase efficiency.  

Shelly would like to take this opportunity to let lenders know that her first Kiva loan helped her business very much. She was able to increase her floating capital by 7,500 ZMK, which enabled her to serve more customers. With that loan, Shelly estimates her business grew by at least 20%. With a portion of her profits, she reinvested the money to pay for a road sign that directs customers to her shop.  

This growth has enabled Shelly to earn more profit. With her increased income, she also supports her sister in completing her education.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop so that she can serve customers faster in her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 60 years old and the first-born in a family of five. He lives in Chipata with his wife and six children.  He operates his own Zoona mobile money transfer shop.

Before Joseph started running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business, he was in formal employment for 37 years. Nowadays, he enjoys the opportunity to run his own business, and be responsible for his own success. Joseph’s business deals in the transfer of money from one location to another. He has been running his business for 10 months now which he started with an initial working capital of $1,000. 

Joseph’s current challenge is accessing working capital so that he can grow his business and serve additional customers. He explains that his business has not expanded much and the reason for this is that he does not have the necessary capital to invest in his business in order to offer his services to more customers.  Having more cash in hand will allow Joseph to serve more customers, which will provide him with additional income. Joseph is hopeful that once he starts making this additional profit, he can purchase a laptop for enhanced service delivery to his customer base. 

Joseph is grateful for the opportunity to be connected with Kiva lenders. He says this loan is the beginning of great things for his family and business.

loans.use: to grow his Zoona money transfer business by adding to his working capital which will allow him to serve more customers at his shop.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a farmer doing tea growing in the Nyakazinga-Mashonga-Kyamuhunga-Igara-Bushenyi area. He is twenty-nine years old and is married. He has one child who is five years old. He started growing tea in 2007 and has carried on the business to date. He also has a boda boda (motorcycle transport) which gives him additional income every month. He started farming with an aim of having a steady source of income so that he becomes financially stable. 

Nathan’s challenge is the dry season which affects his garden and hence negatively affects the yield. His clients are tea-traders from the same location and he plans to use the loan money (2,500,000 UGX) to buy fertilizers which would result in better yields. He is hard-working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
