The story of Mina, daughter of Misan :

I live in Ujung Alang village at Kampung laut. The house is surrounded by brackish water. My father is a fisherman, and the income is uncertain. This program is very helpful for my family. 

The distance from my home to school is about 15 kilometers, and I usually go to school at 5:15 a.m with my friend. In this school I will learn about accountancy as my major, which I choose because I want to be a successful accountant. After graduating from vocational school, I hope to work in a company or factory. I hope from this school I can get a good job easily. My hobby is reading books. I just want to say thank you so much for the Kiva program. Thanks for your help. 

In this picture are Mr. and Mrs. Misan and their daughter, Mina.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem, aged 62, is married and has five children, four of whom have already settled into marriage. He is a farmer who has been growing rice crops on his own land in Baray district of Kampong Thom province. He has been busy with rice husbandry for years and it is a major source of his income. Thanks to the good condition of his rice crops, he will manage to have an abundant harvest this coming season.

Chem would like to buy a motorcycle to support one of his children, who is dedicated to a recycling business, but can’t afford the purchase. That’s why he has applied for a loan in the sum of  600,000 KHR through HKL to add to his existing money. In this way, he will be able to help his son continue making good progress in his business, and thus earn a better income. Thanks lenders for the support. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to support one of his children who is dedicated to a recycling business.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 48-year-old married woman with no kids.  Elmira has had her own agricultural business for fifteen years already. She has built a greenhouse on a small piece of land, and she is growing vegetables. When her crops are ready she goes out and sells them in the different markets located near her home. In Azerbaijan, there is a daily demand for fruits and vegetables, because of traditional meals.

She has already taken out 2 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good payment history, she has applied for a third loan of 1,800 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat her soil and get a good harvest. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat her soil and get a good harvest

loans.name: Yatiman

texts.en:
This is the story of Dina, daughter of Yatiman:

I live in Bringkeng village. My house is surrounded by rice fields. My father works as a laborer and the income is insufficient. I join with this program because the program is very supportive and I want to be a successful woman. 

The distance from home to school is around 5 kilometers, and my father drives me to school. In this school I want to learn accounting because accountancy is easy to learn and more beneficial to find work in companies. I want to work in a bank. My expectation is that I can get a good job. My hobby is reading books. 

I want to say thanks for this program and this loan so that I can continue my education.

In this picture are Mr. and Mrs. Yatiman and their daughter, Dina.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Lasiman

texts.en:
The story of Novita, daughter of Lasiman: 

I live in the district, my parents work as laborers and their income fails to fulfill our needs. This loan is very helpful for me to fulfill my school fees. 

The distance from my house to school is about 2 kilometers and I go by walking. In vocational school I will learn about the science of accounting and learn how to work in a company. I choose the accounting major because I intend to work at a bank. Besides that, I want to have work in a company. I hope in this school I get much knowledge. 

My hobby is reading books from school. This time I am really happy because I get a loan from this Kiva program. Thank you to lenders and this program. It is very useful for my life. 

In this picture are Mr. and Mrs. Lasiman and their daughter, Novita.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of one son. She belongs to a small and happy family. She does not have more children because of extraordinary expenses and because her husband does not earn sufficient income. 

Her husband owns a small general store, and its turnover is sufficient to afford the expenses of a single family. Her husband wants to grow his business by expanding his shop and his inventories. Therefore, Mumtaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could expand his general store. With the help of this loan her husband will buy flour, pulses (peas and beans), soap, detergent, etc. to sell. 

Mumtaz wants to have a baby girl, but due to some physical disease she is unable to give birth to a baby. Through the store's profit amount she will get better medical treatment so that she could have a baby. She says thank you to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and to the honorable lenders who would take warmth in participating through their support.

loans.use: To buy general store inventory such as flour, pulses, rice, detergent, soaps, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 61 years old and a widow with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase household goods like soap, milk, spices, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

She has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Teofila aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase household goods like soap, milk, spices, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anahi

texts.es:
Anahi es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de celulares económicos de procedencia china los cuales los adquiere en la frontera, comercializándolos en la ciudad de La Paz donde se puede adquirir todo tipo de electrodomésticos, vive en la casa de sus padres, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo necesita para incrementar de su capital, adquiriendo nuevos modelos de celular y  de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Anahi es poder comprar su casa propia brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Anahi runs a business selling cheap Chinese cell phones which she gets at the border and then sells them in La Paz where you can buy all kinds of electrical goods. She lives with her parents in the Villa Nuevo Potosí part of La Paz. 

She needs a loan to buy new cell phone models and in this way increase her income.

Anahi's dream is to buy her own home and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo para su negocio de venta de celulares

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia vive con sus hijos en la ciudad de La Paz.
Patricia es Licenciada en derecho. Patricia necesita el crédito para poder refaccionar un ambiente dentro de su domicilio y de esta forma brindar a sus hijos un hogar acogedor ya que los mismos a medida que van creciendo necesitan su propio espacio.

El sueño de Patricia es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para adquirir su propio Estudio Jurídico y tener mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su Familia.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her children in the city of La Paz. 

Patricia has a degree in law.  She needs this loan in order to do up one of the rooms in her home so that she can offer her children a welcoming home.  The children are now growing up and need their own space.

Patricia's dream is to be able to save up enough money in order to have her own legal firm and earn a higher income.  With this she would be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to do up her home.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали со своей семьей живет в городе Вахдат. Ему 36 лет, он женат и имеет двух дочерей. Шерали год назад открыл интернет-кафе, который приносит ему достаточный доход. Ведь его интернет-кафе расположен в хорошем многолюдном месте. Шерали имеет одного помощника, которому каждый месяц платит зарплату. Его интернет-кафе работает ежедневно с  семи утра до восьми вечера. Шерали в данный момент нуждается в кредите. Часть кредита он собирается потратить на приобретение оборудования в Интернет-кафе, а часть он хочет потратить на ремонт дома. Учитывая, что в Вахдате зимой очень холодно, а летом не выносимо жарко жилищные  дома ежегодно нуждаются в ремонте. По этим причинам Шерали нуждается в кредите и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Sherali lives with his family in the town of Vahdat. He is 36 years old, is married and has two daughters. One year ago, Sherali opened an internet cafe, which brings him a sufficient income, as it is located in a highly trafficked area.  Sherali has one worker, whom he pays a monthly salary. His internet cafe is open daily from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. 

Sherali currently needs a loan. He plans to use part of the loan to buy equipment for the internet cafe, and another part to repair his house. Since winters in Vahdat are very cold and summers are unbearably hot, residential homes require yearly repairs. For these reasons, Sherali needs a loan and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his internet cafe and to repair his house

loans.name: El Mañana Group

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 25 años y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta 

de papelería.   ella comenta que cuando decidió iniciar 

con esta actividad fue porque quería tener su propio 

negocio y como en su comunidad nadie brindaba el 

servicio de papelería pensó que seria una buena inversión y 

gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ya tiene 5 años con esta 

actividad y se encuentra muy contenta ya que es su propia 

fuente de empleo tiene la oportunidad de ganar su propio 

dinero desde su hogar.

Elvira ha solicitado un préstamo de Vision Fund para 

expandir su negocio comprando  lapices, gomas, lapiceros, 

colore, resistol, tijeras, libretas, hojas blancas, hojas de 

colores, cartulinas, papel bond, plastilina, cuadernos, 

libretas.

Elvira y su esposo tienen 2 pequeños  hijos. Elvira está 

orgullosa de su negocio ya que no hay otro como este en su 

comunidad y se siente que ella es de alguna manera, 

ayudar a la gente y los niños que viven alrededor.

ella es integrante de un grupo llamado "El Mañana" el cual 

se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Arroyo de Pita 

donde la principal actividad económica es la siembra y 

cultivo de caña de azúcar.

los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Emma venta de refrescos, Adriana venta de pollo, Candida 

venta de agua de garrafon, Minerva venta de cosméticos, 

Maria del carmen venta de abarrotes, Maria venta de 

cosmeticos, Mariela venta de calzado
texts.en:
Elvira is 25 years old and has a small business selling stationery.  She tells us that when she started this work, it was because she wanted to open her own business and, given that there were no other stationers in the community, she thought that this would be a good investment.  Thanks to her hard work and effort, she now has had the business for five years.  Elvira is very happy as it is her own source of employment and she can earn her own money from her own home.

Elvira has applied for a "Vision Fund" loan in order to expand her business, by buying pencils, pens, glues, colouring pencils, scissors, white paper, coloured paper, card, Plasticine, notebooks, and more.

Elvira and her husband have two young sons.  Elvia is proud of her business as there is no other like it in the community and she feels that, in some way, she is helping the people and children who live nearby. 

Elvira is a member of the "El Mañana" group, which is in the Arroyo de Pita community.  Here the main source of work is from sowing and growing sugar cane.

The other members of the group, and their businesses, are:

Emma - sells soft drinks
Adriana - sells chicken
Candida - sells bottles
Minerva - sells cosmetics
María del Carmen - sells groceries
María - sells cosmetics
Mariela - sells footwear.

loans.use: to buy pencils, pens, glues, colouring pencils, scissors, white paper, coloured paper, card, Plasticine, notebooks, and more.

loans.name: Nurian Saarai

texts.es: Nurian, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos con quienes ella vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Hace 8 años inicio con la venta de mercadería como ser ropa, calzado, cosméticos y achinería. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante y por pedidos.  Ella esta solicitando el tercer ciclo de  préstamo  en ODEF el cual es por 16,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra  de más mercadería como ser uniformes para las fiestas patrias, ropa para niños, calzado, perfumes, cremas entre otros. Este préstamo le ayudara a poder atender los pedidos de los clientes y asi mantener bien a su clientela. Su meta es mejorar la vivienda y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nurian is 36 years old, married, and has three children who live with her in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida. Eight years ago she started selling goods such as clothing, footwear, cosmetics and nicknacks from her house, in the streets, and from orders. Nurian is now seeking her third loan of 16,000 lempiras through ODEF which she will use to buy more merchandise such as outfits for special occasions, children's clothing, footwear, perfumes, lotions etc. 

This loan will help Nurian fill her customers' orders and provide them with better service. Her goal is to improve her house and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: buy more merchandise such as outfits for special occasions, children's clothing, footwear, perfumes, lotions etc.

loans.name: Bonifacio Salvador

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa  alquilada  con su compañera de vida  y sus dos hijos  de 6 y 2 años de edad ,  hace 6 años se dedica a  la venta de calzado en el mercado que está cerca de su casa, es un hombre muy trabajador y sobre todo muy responsable  con su negocio y su hogar, es así como  él ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y poder solventar algunas de las necesidades en el  hogar; el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de  mercadería  como lo es sandalias para  mujer por mayor ya el producto está siendo muy solicitado y con esto poder incrementar su inventario y generar  mayores ingresos y obtener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Our client lives in a rented house with his wife and two children aged 6 and 2. Six years ago he started selling footwear in the market close to his house. He is a hardworking man, and above all very responsible both with his business and his family. He has been able to help his family get ahead and provide them with daily necessities.

He is now seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as women's sandals at wholesale prices as these items are much in demand. In this way he will be able to increase inventory, earn more money, and achieve greater financial stability.

loans.use: buy women's sandals at wholesale prices

loans.name: Abdulqosim

texts.ru: Абдулкосим тот человек, про которого говорят «трудяга». Ему 44 года, он из района А.Джоми. У него жена и пятеро детей. Абдулкосим  простой дехканин. Он работает на 0,18 га участке земли и выращивает огородные культуры. Он занимается растениеводством уже несколько лет и имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Сейчас Абдулкосим готовится к осеннему посеву. Для посева нужны средства. По этой причине он берет кредит для приобретения семян лука, помидора и огурцов, а также минеральных удобрений и топлива. За счет прибыли с продажи урожаев Абдулкосим хочет улучшить бытовые условия.
texts.en:
Abdulqosim is a man that many call a workaholic. He is 44 years old, and is from the region of A. Jomi. He is married with five children. Abdulkosim is a simple farmer. He works on a 0.18 hectare plot of land and grows vegetable crops. He has been working in agriculture for several years and has a lot of experience in the field.

Now Abdulqosim is preparing for the Autumn sowing. To plan his crops, he needs additional funding. For this reason, he is taking out a loan to buy onion, tomato and cucumber seeds, as well as fertilizer and fuel. With the income from selling his vegetables, Abdulqosim hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy onion, tomato and cucumber seeds, as well as fertilizers and fuel for the autumn sowing

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman owns a cosmetic shop in the area of Punjab, Pakistan. He is the only person who earns money for the family. Income generated from his business plays a vital role in the family. He has to face all the family expenditures, including electricity, gas and water bills, food expenses, and his children's school fees.

Usman offers a variety of cosmetic products that includes makeup kits, facial creams, foot and hand creams, scrubs, variety of lotions soaps, hair brushes, and hair pins. All of his customers love the products he offers. 

Currently, he needs to purchase a variety of scrubs and beauty soaps for the shop. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to purchase them. Therefore he has asked for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will help him to purchase the products, as the customers' demand for beauty soaps and scrubs are increasing day by day. He is an honest personwho always tries to offer the best quality products to his customers. 

Usman says hello to the Kiva staff and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of scrubs and beauty soaps to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and chickens

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like soap, spices, milk, soap, etc., for her general store business.

Nelia has been in this business for five years. Nelia earns more income from pig fattening.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like soap, spices, milk, and soap.

loans.name: Jermelyn

texts.en:
This is Jermelyn, 33 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, in the Philippines.   She is married to Ariel.   Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Jermelyn offers massage services. She offers whole-body massage and also does manicure and pedicure for her customers.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy supplies like oil, sanitizers, alcohol, and other products needed in her business. 

Jermelyn hopes to have more customers and dreams of having good health always. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies like oil, sanitizers, alcohol, and other products needed in her massage therapy business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a widow and works hard to support her family. She has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. [Abaca is a strong fibre made from abaca palm leaf.]

Letecia requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of abaca to sell. She has been in this business for nine years now, and in the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of abaca to sell.

loans.name: Marimar Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the featured borrower of the Marimar group.  She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.  They have been close friends since they left their homes in the Philippines and came to work in Lebanon for their living.

Josephine is the lady with her child on her arm.  She is the 42-year-old married mother of two children.  She works in selling clothes from her house to help her husband in making their living and at the same time to stay capable of taking care of her beloved children.

Josephine is taking a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with the new autumn and winter collection.  She will also support her accessories sales with a new collection that will attract customers' attention.

As for the other group members, Rosemarie is the lady standing at the right side of the picture wearing a black dress, and  Marivic is the lady sitting at the bottom of the picture.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with the new autumn and winter collection

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
El Sr. Florencio sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de variedad de  productos según la temporada, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de cargadores y accesorios para celulares y  surtir su mercadería, 
Cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en compra de variedad de mercadería.
texts.en: Florencio continues with his business of selling various seasonal items. He is requesting this loan to buy cell phone chargers and accessories and other merchandise. Florencio says that the previous loan was very helpful, because it allowed him to buy a variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as batteries and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Айнагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 42 years old, and she and her husband are raising four children.  Ainagul has a secondary education.  Her family's main source of income is Ainagul's animal husbandry business, which she started 16 years ago with 20,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Ainagul has two milk cows, one horse, one bull calf, and 40 sheep.  Her monthly income is 5,000 somi (KGS).  

With an aim to further developing her business, Ainagul applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 somi (KGS) to buy cows in order to increase the size of her herd.  Ainagul plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the number of cattle she has, as well as save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан родилась в 1981 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж имеет автомашину Камаз и занимается перевозкой грузов. Гулшан занимается шитьем женской одежды. Гулшан имеет большой опыт в данной сфере и имеет своих клиентов. Она кредитуется повторно и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Младший сын Гулшана учится в лицее, и она должна оплатить за новый учебный год. Однако она не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 550 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulshan was born in 1981.  She is married and is raising three children.  Her husband has a Kamaz heavy-duty truck and is in the transport business.  Gulshan is in the business of sewing women's clothing.  She has a great deal of experience in this field and has clients who come only to her.  This is not Gulshan's first loan, and she has a good credit history.

Gulshan's youngest son is a student in the lyceum and she has to pay his tuition for this school year.  However she doesn't have money.  She is requesting a loan of $550 (USD) to pay her son's tuition.  She is relying on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: o pay for her son's education at the lyceum

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina, 36, is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with three children, aged 1 to 17. 

Rosalina has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety store) and a recreational billiards business for five years. She works hard to help her husband, who works as a driver.

She is asking for a loan to buy detergent, chips, canned goods, noodles, eggs and soft drinks for her store. Her loan will serve as additional capital for her business, to increase her inventory.

In the future, she hopes that her children will be able to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy detergent, chips, canned goods, noodles, eggs and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana is a 55-year-old mother of 5 kids.  She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a hard-working person who takes care of her family by doing business in animal husbandry. 

Yegana raises cattle to sell meat. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her husband supports her in the business. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully. She sells the meat in the central bazaar where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume plenty of meat because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma, and others require beef in their preparation. Her profit is 130 AZN monthly. 

Yegana is applying for new loan of 1,800 AZN in order to expand the business by buying new calves. She plans to raise these calves, fatten them, and sell more meat for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase. This is going to be her 6th credit.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying new calves

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has a child who is nine years old. She describes herself as understanding, patient, and intelligent. 

She operates a bookshop.  She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her shop is located in a busy area. and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital.  

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to add more books for resale. Her business goal is to open another branch within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she can educate her child and purchase land to build a bungalow. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.   Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add more books for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente vive en casa  alquilada  con su esposa  y sus cuatro hijos ellos estudian actualmente, desde  hace varios años se dedica a la venta de  de cocos en su vehículo, Él es un hombre muy trabajador  y responsable,  día con día trabaja poder llevar el sustento que se necesita en casa; el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder realizar la reparación de su vehículo comprando llantas, la batería y reparar los parabrisas, ya que su vehículo es de mucha ayuda para su trabajo y así el podrá seguir llevando el sustento diario a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The borrower lives in a rented house with his spouse and their four children, who are all currently in school. He has worked for a number of years selling coconuts from his vehicle. He is a very hardworking and responsible man. He works every day to take home enough to support his family.

The borrower is asking for this loan to be able to repair his vehicle. He will buy tyres and a battery, and repair his windshield. His vehicle helps him a lot in his work and these repairs will allow him to continue supporting his household without any limitations

loans.use: to buy tyres and a battery, and repair the windshield of his vehicle.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia, 51, is married. She and her husband are blessed with three children. 

Ofelia has been in the vegetable vending business for almost four years. She earns a net income of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) per week. Due to insufficient funds, she would like a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell, such as eggplant, cabbage, squash and string beans.
 
She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell, such as eggplant, cabbage, squash and string beans.

loans.name: Majeeda's Group

texts.en:
Majeeda is the age of 50 and the mother of 7. Her husband and one of her sons own a cattle selling and purchasing business. 

Her husband has been running this business for many years and earning a healthy income for many years. Her son is a married person and the responsible father of 3 children. Both want to buy billy goats to sell on Eid days, because the Eid-Ul-Azha is about to come in several months. Many people like to buy billy goats to immolate on Eid-Ul-Azha. They have been feeding their cattle for many days to sell on Eid for a high cost. In this way they can easily get the maximum reward for their efforts in a month.

Therefore, Majeeda requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband and son can buy more billy goats to sell. Majeeda hopes that they will be able to get maximum income for the current year and can invest the profit in the same business for growth. Majeeda says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Rori

texts.en:
The story of Fikri, son of Rori:

I live in Bringkeng village. My home very often gets the flood, which causes wet surrounding my home because hard rain is often falling down and usually it lasts a few days. Since my village is on lower land, it easily gets flooded. My parents work as laborers, and they work on other people’s land.

This loan is very helpful for me to continue my study and help me to get a job after I graduate from this school. The distance from my home to school is about 7 kilometers, and I go by motorcycle. In this vocational school, I will learn automotives, because I love machinery and my hobby is automotives. The kind of work which I dream of is to become a mechanic. I hope I can get much knowledge at this school and hope I can practice in my real life daily. Besides automotives, my other hobby is football. I spend my free time studying what I learned in school.

Thank you so much for this loan and lenders who give me this loan so I can continue my study.

In the picture is Rori and Fikri, his son.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Juliana Lucinda

texts.es:
Juliana es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus tres hijos, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Juliana pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación.
Por iniciativa propia, ella trabaja como profesora en un centro educativo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Juliana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una refrigeradora, la cual le servirá de mucho para conservar adecuadamente alimentos y bebidas, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesora nombrada.
texts.en:
Juliana is a 36 year old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her three children. She is a hardworking single mother who dedicates herself to helping her family to get ahead. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Juliana was able to study for an Education degree.  
On her own initiative, she works as a teacher in an education center in the city. She works everyday for about 8 hours and believes that she is doing well because of her dedication and her good performance.
Juliana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help offered to her, she will buy a refrigerator which will enable her to preserve food and drinks. She will continue working and striving to achieve her greatest dream: to be a distinguished teacher.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica a la reparación y venta de llantas usadas desde hace más de 2 años, posee un excelente record crediticio, sus servicios son muy demandados, ya que la zona donde se desarrolla su negocio es muy transitada por vehículos, que con frecuencia lo visitan, por esta razón ya posee una clientela establecida, él es una persona honesta, responsable y amable con su clientela, posee un buen carácter, gracias  su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de mas llantas por mayor, herramientas,  etc. y así poder obtener mayores ingresos para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: This borrower lives in his own house along with his life partner and his child.  He's had a business repairing and selling used tires for more than 2 years.  He has an excellent credit history.  There is a strong demand for his services, because the area where his business is located is very busy with lots of vehicles passing through, and many of them visit his business.  For this reason, he already has an established customer base.  He is an honest and responsible person who is friendly with his customers, and he has a good character.  Thanks to his work, he has managed to cover most of the family's expenses.  He is requesting a loan to buy more tires at wholesale, tools, and other supplies.  This way, he will be able to generate more earnings so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more tires at wholesale, tools, etc.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. Janice works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase beverages, soaps, canned goods, shampoos, toothpaste, etc.

Janice has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, soaps, canned goods, shampoos, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
This is Michelle, a 36-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines, who is married to Edsel, an artist, and mother to her children. She and the family manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.


Michelle operates a food processing business. She has a factory a few steps from her house that manufactures the meat products. She earns by selling her goods to her neighbors and to suppliers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.


To help her continue operations of her business, Michelle is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory.


Michelle dreams of expanding her business in order to improve the family's living condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
This is Sandra, 49, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and works hard to provide for her everyday needs. 

Sandra maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products from popular direct-selling brands, such as Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and others. The dealer pays for a customer's order in cash, then gives the customer credit with one month to pay. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue. The difference makes up the profits that dealers are investing in to earn their income. Sandra's regular customers are her neighbours and members of the local community. She earns a minimum 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help continue operating her business, Sandra is requesting a  loan of 14,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Sandra dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics, needed for her business.

loans.name: Mery Katia

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 25 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería.
Por iniciativa propia, Mery trabaja brindando servicios de primeros auxilios en un centro medico de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Mery se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, ella desea tarrajear y poner piso a su hogar, así pues Mery seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Mery is a 25 year old single woman who lives in the city of Ica, district of Parcona, with her parents and siblings. She is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and she works very hard in order to help her family get ahead. Thanks to her hard work, she’s been able to study to be a pharmacist. 

Through her own initiative, Mery works providing emergency services in a medical center in her city. She works every day for 10 hours, and she believes that it’s going well due to her hard work and dedication. 

Mery is very thankful for the Kiva loans which have allowed her to improve her home. She would like to plaster and install a floor in her home. Then Mery will continue to work hard and put forth effort in order to reach her dream of being a successful professional.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en:
Nubar is 55 years old, married, and a mother of four kids. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee. 

Nubar has been raising cattle for the past 16 years. Taking care of animals requires continuous effort, but her husband helps her to raise the cattle. She also sells cheese, yogurt, butter and milk at the market. This is the only source of income for the family. From this business, her monthly profit is 150 AZN.

She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family.
 
She has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to buy more calves. She has plans on expanding the business to meet the high potential for milk in the market. This is her seventh credit. She has a good loan history. 

Nubar appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a poor but hardworking woman, aged 33, who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her family's living standard is low, and she would like to change that and provide her children with an education. She always focuses on how to increase her income and ways to make a living, but due to a lack of capital she is unable to achieve her plans. Her husband is the family's sole source of income, which he earns by provide sheltering services. She is requesting this loan to help her husband buy wooden planks and pillars so that he can provide More shelter. Nadia praises and thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pillars, wooden planks and shelter materials.

loans.name: Madiarjo

texts.en:
This is the story of Febriana, daughter of Madiarjo:

I live in Karang Bawang village, and this is flood-prone area. My parents worked as laborers, and rely on work from others. This loan is very helpful, because my parents’ income is not enough for my school fees. 

Distance from my home to school is about 500 meters, and I go by walking. In this school, I will learn about accountancy and life skills to support employment in the future. I chose accountancy because this subject is in accordance with the wishes and ideals for me. I want a job as a public accountant. In this school, I hope I can be fluent and graduate school with good grades. 

My hobby is reading, and after school I usually help my mother with housework. Thank you for this program and for the loan; this program is very helpful. 

In the picture are Mr. and Mrs. Madiarjo and their daughter, Febriana.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is a 27-year-old married man who has been raising sheep for the past 16 years. He established his own business seven years ago to improve his living, selling meat and milk to a wide market.


Kasem has requested a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase more livestock and expand his business. He hopes to continue expanding in order to reach as many markets as he can and expand his working zone.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and expand his business.

loans.name: Majukumu Group

texts.en: Evergeline is in her early 30s, single and the mother of two children, one of whom attends school. For nine years now, she has been managing two activities: a restaurant and selling home utensils like pans, plates, bowls, cups etc. She is doing fine in her projects, and works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm. This is her first loan request, which she will use to buy food and home utensils to resell.  She plans on expanding her business in the future. Evergeline will share this loan with her group, Majukumu, which has five members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food and home utensils to resell.

loans.name: Manuel Douglas

texts.es: Don Manuel  de 45 años de edad es una persona responsable y emprendedora, vive en casa propia junto a su mama, hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, que luego comercializa por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con esto logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Manuel solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como concentrado, vitaminas, etc. para sus pollos, con esto espera incrementar sus ganancias y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 45 year old Manuel is a responsible and enterprising person. He lives in his own home with his mother. For some years, he has worked raising and fattening chickens which he then sells at different markets that are near to his residence. With this, he is able to cover some of the household expenses. Manuel is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his business such as concentrate, vitamins, etc for his chickens. With this he hopes to increase his profits and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy concentrate, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra es una persona responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive con sus hijos en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras.

Doña Sandra el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de arroz, frijoles, pan, azúcar, café, aguas, refrescos, churros,  carnes de pollo y res, etc. espera que esta inversión le ayude a que las ventas en su negocio aumenten y generarse ingresos que le permitan mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Doña Sandra espera cubrir las necesidades que tiene y en unos años espera que su negocio siga creciendo y se convierta en uno de los  más grandes y reconocidos de la zona.

Doña Sandra su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.




Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto 2013
texts.en:
Sandra is responsible, honest and hardworking.  She lives with her children in a community in San Lorenzo, in Valle, in the south of Honduras.

Sandra needs this loan to buy butter, rice, beans, chicken, red meat, coffee, bread, sugar, "churros" (a doughy, sugary snack), water, soft drinks, and more.  She hopes that this investment will help sales to increase and generate an income that will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

Sandra hopes to be able to pay for necessities and, in a few years, she hopes that her business will continue to grow and become one of the biggest and most well-known in the area.

Sandra's dream is to see her children graduate and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras.  August 2013.

loans.use: to buy butter, rice, beans, chicken, red meat, coffee, bread, sugar, "churros", water, soft drinks, and more.

loans.name: Melis Marisa

texts.es:
Melis, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio de venta de tortillas; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar maíz, leña, cal, gas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual mientras que las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Melis needs to apply for a new loan because she needs more working capital for her business selling tortillas. This loan will help her to buy corn, wood, lime, gas, and other things.
The previous loan enabled her to increase her inventory and to make better profits. Her family circumstances remain the same while her economic situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, lime, gas, and other things.

loans.name: Tuwa

texts.en:
Tuwa is a married man with nine children, four of whom go to school and the rest are adults. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. He cites school fees as his major challenge. 

For the past twenty years, he has operated a bodaboda(motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites high cost of maintenance as his major challenge. 

With the KES 10,000, he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle.

loans.name: Deni

texts.en:
This is the story of Paulus, son of Deni:

I live in Bringkeng village, a very difficult and complicated environment. Most of the people here get failures in harvest time. We get a lot of difficulties in building/making small/micro business because of lack of money. My house is quite far from the downtown. We always get failures in harvesting the rice because of the flood, which often comes unpredictably. I still remember when my mom gave birth to my second sister; the big flood was coming up to one meter high. 

My parents worked as laborers; this loan is very helpful for me and my family. I am very happy to get this loan. With this loan I can continue my study, and after that I will get work in what I want. Distance from my house to school is about seven kilometers. I ride a bike, and then take the public transportation to reach school. 

I studied mechanical engineering; it’s likely to get me a job. I love machines. Therefore, I choose majoring in machines. I want to work in a machine industry. I hope I can learn and practice about the machines. 

My hobby is playing football, and after school, I usually go fishing to eat. Thank you so much for this loan and for every lender. 

In the picture are Mr. Deni and their son, Paulus.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es: Diego es un hombre de 28 años de edad, padre de una hija de 6 años (ver foto) y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenzó a laborar como conductor, inicialmente manejaba camiones, pero hace algún tiempo se dedica a transportar personas en una buseta que adquirió, especialmente entre los municipios del oriente antioqueño. El cliente es activo, trabajador, dedicado a su labor y a su familia, quien es el motor principal de su vida y, es por ellos que se motiva para buscar nuevas opciones que le permitan salir adelante y seguir sobrepasando los diferentes obstáculos que afectan directamente su labor, como el alto costo del combustible y de los repuestos para el mantenimiento del vehículo. Por ello solicita el crédito que desea invertir en la compra de un juego de llantas para la buseta y el seguro obligatorio del vehículo (SOAT), con esto podrá continuar prestando sus servicios y ofrecer a los pasajeros mayor seguridad al transportarlos, de esta forma podrá fortalecer su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar y velar por el bienestar de su pequeña hija. Diego sueña con poder adquirir a mediano plazo una buseta de un modelo más moderno, que sea confortable, amplia y cómoda para que los usuarios del servicio se sientan a gusto y así poder mejorar la economía de su familia y  dar a su hija la posibilidad de tener una excelente educación para que se forje un futuro próspero y exitoso cuando crezca.
texts.en:
Diego is a 28-year-old man and the father of a six-year-old daughter (who appears in the photo).  He and his partner are in a common-law relationship.  He started out working as a truck driver, but some time ago he began transporting people with a minibus that he acquired.  Most of his trips are to the towns in the western part of the Department of Antioquia.  

Diego is active, hardworking, and dedicated to his job and his family, who serves as his primary motivation in life.  For this reason, he looks for new ways to get ahead and overcome the obstacles that directly affect his work, such as the high price of fuel and spare parts for maintaining his vehicle.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of a set of tires for his minibus and mandatory vehicle insurance.  This will enable him to provide better service and offer better safety when transporting passengers.  As a result, Diego will be able to strengthen his business and generate more income to sustain his household and provide for the well-being of his young daughter.  

In the midterm, Diego dreams of acquiring an upgraded model of minibus that is comfortable and spacious so that his passengers will prefer his service.  This will lead to a better financial situation for his family so that he can provide his daughter with an excellent education that will help forge a prosperous and successful future for when she grows up.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires for his minibus and mandatory vehicle insurance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
This is Analina, 40, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a driver. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Analina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat homecooked meals during evenings, when all family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and a means of frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one person to two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than purchasing raw food. Analina's regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. 

Analina earns a minimum 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. To help continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more products, such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and frozen foods. 

Analina dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and other products needed in her business, such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
This is Virginita, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is single and works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Virginita operates a market stall where sells fruits and vegetable products. She buys a quantity of fruits and vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php22, 000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Virginita hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy varieties of fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando, 43, is married. He and his wife are blessed with two children. 

Rolando has managed a hog raising business for almost two years and earns a net income of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) when he sells a hog. 

He would like a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase hogs to raise as well as hog feed. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can improve and expand his business to become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise and hog feed

loans.name: Sugiyono

texts.en:
This is the story of Saidun, son of Sugiyono:

My hometown is Kawunganten; this is small district. My parents work as laborers; if there is no work, they are jobless. This loan is really a help to me and my parents because it would ease the burden of my father. Distance from my house to school is about 100 meters, and by walking. 

In school, I learn about automotive, and I choose the automotive major because I love it. After graduation, I want to work at an automotive factory. I hope I can be excellent in school. 

My hobby is playing football, and at home I usually help my parents to do their housework. I just want to say many thanks to every lender and this loan; also this program that helps with my school fees. 

In the picture are Mr. and Mrs. Sugiyono and their son, Saidun.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Ziyafeddin

texts.en:
Ziyafeddin is 49, married, and a father of two children. Ten years ago, Ziyafaddin decided to work on his own family business so that he can earn more money, as his salary does not cover his family's needs. He is engaged in agriculture, selling milk products and clover. 

Now he wants to build a little store where he can sell home-grown produce. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1,600 AZN. This will help him to expand his trading activities.

loans.use: to purchase the construction materials to build a little store where he can sell home-grown produce.

loans.name: Zasik

texts.en:
Zasik lives in Mrgavet village of Ararat region. Her family consists of her elderly pensioner mother (82 years old), husband, son and daughter. Her husband, son and daughter work in the private sector. 

Zasik is currently busy with her livestock of hens and cultivation of barley. She also cultivates plants in the greenhouse. She now wants to expand her livestock and enlarge the plant cultivation. Besides, the greenhouse is in poor condition and needs to be renovated to function more effectively. For these reasons Zasik needs a loan of USD 3,000 to buy pigs and forage for them, buy seeds of plants and renovate the greenhouse. 

The loan will be a great support to this initiative woman. She really hopes for the lenders good wishes in helping her obtain the needed amount of financial resources.

loans.use: to buy pigs and forage for them, buy seeds of plants, and renovate the greenhouse.

loans.name: Sara Victoria

texts.es: Sara, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre  soltera y tiene dos hijos con quienes  vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Sara trabajaba en una empresa privada  anteriormente. Hace  5 años  decidió por su propio negocio donde elabora  piñatas de diferentes diseños y las vende en su casa por pedidos.  El préstamo que ha solicitado ya es el quinto ciclo y este es por  2,000 Lempiras, los cuales va  invertir en la compra de materia prima como alambre, papel, periódicos, tape y pegamento. Ella piensa  aprovechar la temporada  donde se celebra el dia de los niños y niñas y podrá incrementar sus ventas. Su meta a futuro es tener un local en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sara is 53 years old and a single mother. She has two children, and they live in the city of San Pedro Sula. Previously, Sara worked in a privately owned factory. Five years ago she decided to start her own business where she makes pinatas with various types of designs. She sells them from her home by order. 

The loan that she’s requested is her fifth, and it’s for 2,000 Lempiras. She will invest in the purchase of materials like wire, paper, newspaper, tape, and glue. The time when Children’s Day occurs is approaching, and she’ll be able to increase her sales. Her dream for the future is to have a store in the market.

loans.use: to buy materials like wire, paper, newspaper, tape, and glue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to attract more customers by increasing her float limit.

loans.name: Margarita Reina

texts.es: Doña margarita vive en casa propia con su  esposo y sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 6 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, desde  hace varios años que se dedica  a la venta de comida, es una persona muy  trabajadora , honesta  y muy amable, es por ello que su clientela es bastante grande ya que es una mujer muy capaz de la actividad que realiza eso hace que sus labores las cumpla a la perfección; su negocio es el medio por el cual ella lleva el sustento a casa,  es por ello que ahora esta solicitado un crédito para la compra de materia prima para su comedor  como: pollos, carnes, verduras, maíz, fruta, refrescos etc. y mejorar la cocina que es la que muestra la fotografía  para seguir con su trabajo y así poder incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos y tener una notable mejora en su calidad de  vida.
texts.en: Margarita lives in her own home with her husband and their three kids aged 15, 13, and 6 who are currently in school. She’s been selling food for a few years. She’s a hardworking person, honest and friendly. For that reason, she has a lot of clients. She’s very competent in her work since she does it to perfection. She supports her family through her business. For that reason she’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her small restaurant like children, meat, vegetables, corn, fruit, drinks, etc. She also wants to improve the kitchen that’s shown in the photograph to continue her work, increase sales and income, and have a noticeable improvement in quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, corn, fruit, drinks, etc. and make improvements to the kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 32 años de edad  vive en casa alquila  con su esposo  y sus cuatro hijos ellos estudian  actualmente,  hace varios años se dedica a la venta de sandalias su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado e se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia,  es una mujer muy responsable,  amable y atenta en sus labores además de trabajadora  es por esa razón  que su clientela es fiel a  sus productos;  Doña María esta solicita un crédito para  poder realizar la compra de mas sandalias por mayor  y de tal manera poder incrementar su inventario y sus ingresos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and lives with her husband and their four children who are in school. She’s been selling sandals for a few years. Her store is in the market and close to where she lives. She’s a very responsible and friendly woman. She’s thoughtful and hardworking which is why she has loyal customers. 

Maria is asking for a loan to buy sandals in bulk sot that she can increase her inventory and sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sandals in bulk.

loans.name: Alex Alexander

texts.es:
Alex es un hombre de 35 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Alex no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia,Alex trabaja en su pequeña carpintería, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Alex se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara equipos y herramientas para su carpintería, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
Alex is 35 years old and single. He lives in the city of Piura, in the Jayanca district. He’s hardworking and enthusiastic, and he puts effort into everything he does in order to get ahead. Sadly, because he couldn’t afford it and had to work, Alex wasn’t able to study for a professional career. 

By his own initiative, Alex works in his small carpentry business. He works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes that everything is going well due to his hard work and dedication. 

Alex is very thankful for the Kiva loans which have allowed him to be able to buy equipment and tools for his carpentry business. He will continue working hard so that he can achieve his dream of having a large carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 6 years. He describes himself to be honest, determined, careful and God-fearing. 

He operates a property agency where he manages houses for clients. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area with many residential houses, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to purchase property. 

Joseph will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy a piece of land . His business goal is to open another property agency office within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he can educate his children up to university level.  This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a piece of land

loans.name: Llian

texts.en:
Llian has been working in the film business for about six years now, but he has been a photographer for over ten years. 

Llian says, "I love being creative.  I literally love creating something out of nothing; make something as beautiful as it can be, and then showing it off to the world." 

This love for the creative is what inspired him to become a cinematographer. He knows he will face many challenges, but he hopes that with this Kiva loan, he will be able to purchase his own camera in order to follow his dream and start his own cinematography business.

loans.use: to purchase a camera in order to follow his dream and start his own cinematography business.

loans.name: Sugianto

texts.en:
The story of Dewi, daughter of Sugianto:

I live in small village, and the village name is Grugu. The population is not crowded; there are swamps and rice fields around my house. My father works as a laborer. This loan can ease the burden of my parents. The distance to school from my home is about four kilometers. I go to school with my friend. She helps me to go to school with her motorcycle, and we ride together. 

In this school, I will learn new things. I choose an accounting major because I want to be a good accountant. After I graduate, I want to work in the office. I hope to gain as much knowledge as possible, so that I can get provision for work. 

My hobby is listening to music, and I help mom with selling in the shop after I come back from school. Thank you so much to the lenders and this program that helps with my school fees. 

In the picture are Mr. and Mrs. Sugianto and their daughter, Dewi.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Jerry Julio

texts.es:
Jerry es un hombre de 34 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Jerry trabaja en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Jerry se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una computadora, la cual utilizara para avanzar su trabajo pendiente en su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Jerry is a 24 year old single man. He lives in the city of Canete, in the district of Imperial. He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he applies himself in order to get ahead. Thanks to his efforts, he’s studying to become a lawyer. 

Through his own initiative, Jerry works in a municipal factory in his city. He works every day for about 10 hours, and he thinks it’s going well due to his dedication and good performance. 

Jerry is very thankful for the Kiva loans which have allowed to be able to buy a computer which he uses in order to be able to work from home. Then he’ll continue working hard in order to achieve his dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mario Luis Ramon

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus tres hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Mario trabaja como empleado en una empresa de entretenimiento de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Mario se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una moto lineal de segunda mano, la cual utilizar para transportarse hasta su trabajo, de esta manera desea ahorrar un poco de dinero, el mismo que le servirá para poco a poco lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mario is a 45 year old man who lives in the city of Canete, district of Imperial, with his three children. He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he applies himself in order to get his family ahead. Thanks to his hard work, he’s studying to work as a legal professional. 

Through his own initiative, Mario works in a factory in the middle of the city. He works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes that it’s going well due to his dedication and good performance. 

Mario is very thankful for the Kiva loans which have allowed him to buy a used motorcycle that he uses to go to work. Using this, he hopes to save a little money which will help him achieve his dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Tania Janet

texts.es:
Tania es una joven de 18 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Tania no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Tania trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Tania se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada compara una cómoda para su hogar, ya que ella y su familia guardan su ropa en cajas y tienen riesgos que insectos o la lluvia del invierno las deteriore, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Tania is a young woman who’s 18 years old. She live in the city of Ica, district of Parcona, with her parents and siblings. She’s hardworking and enthusiastic, and she wants to be successful. Sadly, due to a lack of money and because she needs to work, she’s not been able to study for a professional career. 

Through her own initiative, Tania works as a laborer in an agricultural field in her city. She works every day for about 10 hours, and she believes that it’s going well due to her hard work and dedication. 

Tania is very thankful for the Kiva loans which have allowed her to buy a chest of drawers for her home. She and her family had kept their clothes in boxes, and there was a risk of damage due to insects or winter rain.  She will continue working hard in order to achieve her dream of being a professional.

loans.use: to buy a chest of drawers.

loans.name: Argelia

texts.es:
Argelia de 38 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta el bachillerato. Ella es una señora soltera, vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la producción agrícola, junto con su padre, hace aproximadamente 15 años. Además, de la agricultura también se dedica a la venta de tortillas, para obtener ingresos extras.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos e insecticidas,  para el mejor crecimiento de la milpa. Con ello logrará satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar, que día a día están presentes. 

Ella desea, hacer más grande el negocio de las tortillas, y que le sea rentable para su familia y le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Thirty-eight year old Argelia had the opportunity to study through high school.  She is a single woman and lives with her parents.  She has made her living in agricultural production with her father for approximately 15 years.  In addition to agriculture, she also works selling tortillas to get extra income.

The loan that she is applying for is for the purchase of fertilizers, compost and insecticides, so that the cornfield grows better.  With this, she will be able to meet the household's basic needs that are present day after day.

She wishes to grow her tortilla business so that it is profitable for her family and allows her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost and insecticides, so that the cornfield grows better.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en: Aramayis is from Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He lives with his family – his mother, his brother, his wife, and his one-year-old son. To take care of his large family, Aramayis breeds livestock including cows and piglets. He also cultivates sunflower, alfalfa, peaches, and apricots. His mother and his wife help him greatly in his daily work. Breeding livestock and horticulture are the most important sources of the family's income. Aramayis now needs to buy forage for his livestock. He also needs to renovate his agricultural machinery for efficient harvesting. A loan of 1,500 USD will be a huge support to this hardworking family. They are thankful to all the lenders who will help to collect the needed loan.

loans.use: to buy forage for his livestock and to renovate his agricultural machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell. Her earnings help her to meet her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family and meet their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to have her own stall and dreams that her family will always be in a good condition. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from her study of the word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell.

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
María de 65 años, posee un nivel académico hasta el 6º grado de educación básica, vive junto a una nieta que tiene 16 años quien se encuentra estudiando el 8º grado del centro escolar. Ella procreo cuatro hijos.

Ella se dedica a administrar su propia tienda, en la cual trabaja hace de 3 años. Dicho trabajo lo aprendió por si sola, viéndose en la necesidad de satisfacer las necesidades presentes en el diario vivir.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar aceite, azúcar, jabón, entre otros productos de la canasta básica. Todo esto con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades básicas, que se le presentan a sus clientes.

María sueña con tener una tienda más grande, que le permita seguirle dando la educación a su nieta. y continuar cubriendo las necesidades básicas  en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sixty-five year old María has a 6th grade level of education.  She lives with a granddaughter who is 16 years old and who is in the 8th grade at school.  She has four children.

She makes her living managing her own store, in which she has worked for 3 years.  She learned this work on her own, finding herself in need of satisfying the necessities of daily life.

The loan for which she is applying is to buy oil, sugar, soap and other basic needs.  All this is to improve her sales and satisfy her customers' basic needs.

María dreams of having a bigger store, which would allow her to continue educating her granddaughter and to continue meeting her household's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, soap and other basic needs.

loans.name: Santos Benigna

texts.es:
La  señora Santos es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus 2 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta  de dulces,  refrescos, galletas, etc.
Doña Santos tiene su negocio desde hace más de 8 años. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de  refrescos,  dulces,  agua, galletas, bombones, chocolates,  etc.  Producto que necesita para poder satisfacer a sus clientes.
Doña Santos espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más y  cubrir así las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Santos en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una tienda más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad. 




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Agosto   del   2013
texts.en:
Santos is a responsible, hardworking, and honest woman who lives with her two children in southern Honduras.  She sells candies, soft drinks, cookies, etc.

Santos has had her business for eight years and needs this loan to buy soft drinks, candy, water, cookies, bon bons, chocolates, etc.  so she can satisfy her customer demand.

Santos hopes that her sales will increase with more inventory, so she can better cover her needs and also improve her family’s quality of life.

Santos hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she can have a bigger store, well known in the area, and for her children to become people with more opportunities in society.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou. She previously accessed a 27,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
