It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Norleta is requesting a Php35,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

She hopes to expand her business and have other sources of income. She dreams of being successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Chola's Group

texts.en:
Chola, a 40-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children. One of them is still in school and dependent on her. To make a living, Chola has been selling groceries for two years. 

Her group consists of four members applying for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the second cycle loan for Chola and she has successfully repaid the first. The past loan has improved her family's living conditions. 

As the leader of this group, Chola will use her portion to buy grocery items for her business. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income so that she can further expand her business to triple her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Samtredia district with her husband and two infant children. She graduated from teaching college and works as a teacher at the local public school. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family. 

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps residents to make a living. The family is involved in the husbandry business. They have three cows and produce dairy products to sell. Additionally, they have a plot of agricultural land where watermelon is grown. They sell the harvested watermelon seasonally. 

With the loan of $2,500 USD, Natia will build a mill and will get orders to grind corn. Natia hopes that the business will be successful, as there are many families who grow corn in their village. It is obvious that the job will be hard, as she has no experience in this field. However, she and her husband are ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. 

Natia decided to start this family business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times because she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit through a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased with help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a mill.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is from the village of Kvirike,  in the Adjara Region. She is 22 years old and works as a waitress at the local café. Her monthly wage is approximately $240. Diana is married and lives with her child, spouse and parents. Her father runs small scale agricultural business and grows maize and nuts on the family-owned plot of land. He also is involved animal husbandry business and breeds pigs. 

The existing family funds are modest and hardly enough to cover food and every day expenses. That is the reason why Diana decided to start a clothing trading business. She has no experience in this field but hopes she will cope with all the difficulties and generate a good income since there are not many clothing stores in her district. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices and sell them among her coworkers and community members. She will be very nice to her customers and do her job with love and care.

Diana will be able to earn more income and make savings to satisfy the everyday needs of her family members. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
Rodalyn is 37 years old and married with five children who are in school. Rodalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rodalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, noodles, egg, etc.

Rodalyn has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Rodalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her family in Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in making and selling salted fish, and in buying and selling fresh fish. This business has existed for 10 years now. 

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish and salt for her business. She hopes that with the help of the loan her family's living standards will improve and that the profitability of her business will increase in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and salt.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina is 41 years old and she is married with three children. All her children attend school. She is a businesswoman and she has a grocery store in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for five years now and she learned about Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages for her business. In five years time she wants to be running two more stores that will increase her income. The challenge that she faces is the cost of goods which at times is so high. The extra income that she raises will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Verma June

texts.en: Verma June is 34 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, bread, coffee, spices, soft drinks, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Verma June would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, bread, coffee, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Lora

texts.en:
Lora is 53 years old and lives in the Samtredia district. She works as a cleaner at a ceremonial hall and gets small monthly income. Lora’s income is too small and she has decided to request a loan to start a clothing business. She has been seeking credit among local financial institutions but her attempts have been unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

Lora is requesting a 900 USD loan to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and resell it to community members door-to-door. Her customers will be her coworkers and neighbors. Lora’s loan application has been approved under the framework of a loan program between Kiva and Credo. This joint initiative enables the rural poor and inexperienced to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. Lora plans to sell a wide assortment or well-priced clothing for men, women and children. It is obvious that this job will be hard for Lora, but she is ready to deal with her difficulties and gradually develop her business. The Start Up credit will be a great support for her as her income will be significantly increased.

loans.use: to begin a clothing business

loans.name: Mafia's Group

texts.en:
Mafia is a 36-years old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She owns a beauty parlor on partnership. Her partner is expert in hair style and cutting; she is expert in makeovers. Both are fully professional in their arts. She provides makeover services to her clients at home also. Most of their clients belong to the neighborhood and her clients appreciate her artistry. With the passage of time her beauty products are almost used up and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Mafia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion etc. She wants to establish a separate parlor in a nearby town because she has to divide the profit amount into two equal parts. Mafia says thanks to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a postgraduate course

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a 28-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 6. For the last five years Geraldine has relied on rice farming for her family's needs. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor. 

The loan will pave the way for her to continue her business while also supporting the basic needs of her family. Any income will be for her family's healthy diet and to pay the school fees of her child. In the future, Geraldine hopes to continue improving her business and be successful with it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is married and resides in Sinonoc, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she and her husband sell fish in their community. She's been a member of Gata Daku MPC since 2005, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more fish to resell. She wants to use her generated revenue as additional capital in order to improve her business and to have more income for their needs.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in the Kilifi area, north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 36-year-old single businesswoman. For the last five years she has been running a grocery that deals with vegetables and fruits. The business has been doing fine and the only challenges in the business are the weather and customers not paying on time. She started her business from small savings that she had made and the business started growing from there. She knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for selling. She will use the extra income to build a rental house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ruzica

texts.en:
Ruzica is a married mother of three adult children, living together in the southern part of Kosovo in a minority community. At this time she is working as a cleaner in a hospital and her husband is working as a guard, but both of them have very low salaries. During the winter time in Kosovo the temperatures can become freezing and it's usually very cold with snow. 

Now, for the first time, Ruzica is asking for a loan to pay for steam heating in her home. She wants to install the heating system for warming the house, which will help her to warm her house more effectively and efficiently and help prevent her children from getting the flu and other illnesses. Ruzica believes that with this loan her dream of a better heating system and warmer winters will finally come true. Without the help of this loan, it will be impossible to pay for the system from her salary. Her goals are to have better living conditions for her family, to provide them with a healthy environment and future, and to be able to save overall for her family. She wants to thank all the lenders!

loans.use: to pay for steam heating in her home

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 38 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Divina works very hard to provide for them.

Divina runs a business selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell. She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products to sell

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en: Ramonita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years now. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, noodles, eggs, soft drinks, etc. In the future, Ramonita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, noodles, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia resides in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, along with her family. Her husband is a teacher while she manages an encoding business to earn additional income. In 2009, Virginia joined GDMPC and has successfully repaid the previous loans used for her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan for 35,000 PHP to acquire additional units of computers to be used for business expansion. She hopes to generate more income and be able to have more units. Her hope is to be able to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide internet services in her community

loans.name: Laila Fay

texts.en: Laila Fay is married with a child. Her husband serves as a barangay council member in their community. She operates a motor transportation and rental business to earn a living. In 2012, she had joined Gata Daku MPC and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for motor maintenance. She borrowed a new loan of 20,000 PHP to buy new tires and motor carpet to provide better services. She plans to use her generated revenue to acquire more units in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a motor carpet for her transportation business

loans.name: Romie

texts.en:
Romie is married with a child. He lives with his family in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental and he operates a service-based transportation business. Romie joined Gata Daku MPC recently.

Romie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to maintain his motorcycle to provide better service. In the future, he plans to have more motorcycles to increase his income and provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Babina

texts.en:
Babina is 53 years old and married with two children. For the past eight years, she has been buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Babina has borrowed 15 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her agricultural business. 

Babina is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Chila Mae

texts.en:
Chila Mae is 29 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. For the past seven years, she has been raising livestock in the Philippines. Chila Mae has borrowed 13 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Chila Mae is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es: Sebastián es un joven de 21 años de edad, padre de un bebé de 1 año. Luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios y por falta de oportunidades y experiencia laboral, tuvo que dedicarse a la venta ambulante, ofreciendo frutas y mecato por diferentes calles de la ciudad, de esta manera genera ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar y velar por el bienestar de su hijo. El cliente es activo, pujante, emprendedor y responsable, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y aunque no ha contado con los recursos suficientes, sigue luchando con esfuerzo y dedicación, motivado por el amor a su hijo. Esto  lo lleva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, que desea invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mango, mandarina, aguacate, solteritas entre otros), así podrá aumentar la variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y las ganancias que obtiene, lo que le dará la posibilidad de seguir respondiendo por su hijo, llevar el sustento a su hogar y seguir avanzando para que, en un futuro a mediano plazo pueda cumplir el sueño de convertirse en un distribuidor de frutas y verduras, brindar oportunidades de empleo y tener mejor solvencia económica para garantizar a su hijo una buena educación, un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 21 years old and the father of a one-year-old baby. After graduating from high school, he had few opportunities and little work experience, so he had to begin selling fruit and snacks throughout the different streets of the city. Sebastian supports his family and looks after his son with the income he earns.

Sebastian is described as energetic, hard-working and responsible, with an entrepreneurial spirit and a strong desire to get ahead. Despite his lack of resources, he is very determined and continues to work hard, motivated by his son, whom he loves very much.

Sebastian is requesting this loan to buy goods such as mangoes, tangerines, avocadoes, solteritas [typical Colombian fried pastries] and other items at wholesale prices. He hopes to offer his customers a wider variety of items in order to increase his sales and improve his profits. Sebastian wants to continue to be able to provide for his son and family, and he hopes in the near future to realize his dream of becoming a fruit and vegetable distributor. He hopes this will give him more opportunities for employment and better finances, so that he can give his son a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, tangerines, avocadoes, solterita pastries and other items at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mashurakhon

texts.ru: Машурахон родилась в 1975 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она имеет средне -специальное образование по специальности бухгалтера. Машурахон несколько лет назад сильно заболела и перестала работать. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Ее дети учатся в лицее. Она должна оплатить за учебу своих детей, но не имеет денег, так как она использует полученные от мужа деньги для покупки продуктов питания и одежды для детей. Она хочет, чтобы ее дети росли умными людьми и образованными. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора лицея. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mashurakhon was born in 1975.  She is married and is raising four children.  She has a vocational degree in accounting.  For several years, Mashurakhon was ill and unable to work.  Her husband is an emigrant laborer in the Russian Federation.  Her children are students in the lyceum.  She needs to pay for her children's tuition, but she doesn't have any money because she uses the money her husband sends her for food and clothing for her children.  

She hopes that her children will grow up to be intelligent and well educated people.  She is requesting a loan to pay for this year's tuition for her children.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education at the lyceum

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 26 years old and is a married mother of six children whose ages range between 3 months old and 12 years old. She is a housewife and a stay-at-home mother while her husband transports goods for others in order to earn a living. They all live in a Roma community and, as with all Roma communities,  they also live in very poor conditions. The house that they live in is very old and needs renovations in order to offer a healthy life and environment. 

She is requesting a loan in order to reface her house and to change the doors. This loan will help them a lot, because without this help, she could not manage to renovate her house. In the future, she hopes to improve the living conditions of her family. Her goal is to give her family better living conditions. She and her husband are very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To reface her house and to change the doors

loans.name: Gulru

texts.ru: Гулру родилась в 1968 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети близнецы. Она окончила Московского торгового института. Гулру 10 лет работала в ИМОН ИНТЕРНЕШНЛ директором филиала. Данное время она работает в государственном учреждении. Гулру хочет, чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование. Оба ее дочери учатся в лицее. Она должна оплатить за новый учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gurlu was born in 1968.  She is married and is raising two children.  Her children are twins.  Gurlu graduated from the Moscow Institute of Trade.  Gurlu worked for IMON International for 10 years as a branch manager.  Presently, she works for a government institution.  

Gurlu wants her children to receive good educations.  Both of her daughters attend the lyceum and Gurlu has to pay this year's tuition.  She is requesting a loan of $1,100 (USD).  She is relying on your kindness..

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Bahri

texts.ru: Бахри 51 года. Она вдова и у нее 1 ребенок. Бахри более 15 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она ткачиха ковров. Бахри этим ремеслом занимается с детства. Она покупает шерсть, очищает шерсть и изготавливает нитки. Затем она красит нитки и ткёт ковры. Ее невестка помогает ей введению бизнеса. Бахри еще дополнительно работает в школе уборщицей. Она серьёзно заболела и ей необходимо лечится. Она не имеет денег для покупки лекарств, чтобы лечится. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки лекарств. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Bahri is 51 years old. She is a widow and has one child. Bahri has more than 15 years of experience operating her own business. She is a weaver of carpets. Bahri has been weaving since childhood. She buys wool, cleans the wool, and makes the thread. She then paints the thread and weaves carpets. Her daughter helps her in the course of her business. Bahri also works as a school janitor. She has become seriously ill and urgently needs to be treated. She has no money to buy medicine for her treatment. She has requested a loan of 3000 TJS to buy medicine. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her treatment

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una señora casada de 38  años de edad, vive junto a sus 5 hijos quienes son 2 hombres y 3 mujeres en el Sector Xeabaj, Aldea Tzununa, Santa Cruz La Laguna,  Sololá.

Ella  se dedica a la agricultura cultivando café a unos metros de su vivienda. Eligio esta actividad porque es donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos que le han ayudado a salir adelante junto a su familia en cuanto a lo económico.
Comenta que el clima de Santa Cruz La Laguna es muy cálido es por ello que su cultivo es bastante productivo, por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de pilones de café que servirán para cosecharlo y así mejorar sus ingresos y ganancias.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is a 38 year old married woman who lives with her five children, three girls and two boys in Xeabaj neighborhood, Tzununa village, Santa Cruz La Laguna, Sololá. She grows coffee a few meters from her house. She choose this activity as it provides most of the income which has helped her family get ahead in the economic sense. She says that the climate in Santa Cruz La Laguna is very hot and for this reason production is high. 

Marta is requesting a loan of 5000 GTQ to buy coffee plants to cultivate, thus increasing her income and profits. Her dream is to generate more revenue to be able to get her children ahead with their studies and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Ramon Enrique

texts.es: Don Ramón de 53 años de edad, es una persona dedicada a sus hijos, él habita con su esposa en el municipio de Chontales, trabaja para un hospital de su pueblo ejerciendo la labor de camillero. Solicita este crédito para realizar mejoras en la cocina de su casa, así como cambiar tablas y el zinc que actualmente tiene como paredes de su casa el cual se le mete el agua cuando llueve por el mal estado de las mismas, con esta mejora desea contar con mejores condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ramón is a 53 years old who is very dedicated to his children. He lives with his wife in the municipality of Chontales. He works in a local hospital as a stretcher-bearer.  

Ramón is requesting this loan to make improvements to the kitchen of his house. He wants to replace the planks and zinc sheeting that currently cover the walls as it leaks when it rains due to their deteriorated condition. He hopes to improve the condition of his house with this work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, cinder blocks, re-bar and sand.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озода молодая и умная девушка. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Озода в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Технологический Университет Таджикистана по специальности учитель физики. Она с детства всегда мечтала стать учителем как ее отец. Ее мать не имеет высшее образование и поэтому она всесторонне поддерживает Озоду, чтобы она получила высшее образование. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ozoda is a young and intelligent woman. She is single and lives with her parents. This year, Ozoda graduated from high school and enrolled in the Technological University of Tajikistan majoring in teaching physics. As a child, she always dreamed of becoming a teacher like her father. Her mother does not have a college degree, and fully supports Ozoda receiving a college education. She has to pay her tuition, but has no money. She has requested a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for her education

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба родилась в 1976 года. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Матлуба более 7 лет занимается переработкой косточек. В ведение бизнеса ей помогают ее дети. Матлуба имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Ее сын учится в лицее и поэтому она должна оплатить за учебный год своего сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 550 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына в лицее. Она кредитуется повторно и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Matluba was born in 1976. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Matluba has more than 7 years of experience in seed processing. Running the business helps her children. Matluba has additional income from raising livestock. Her son is in a lyceum and she needs to pay for his tuition for the year. She has requested a loan of $550 to pay for her son's tuition. She has borrowed before and has a good credit history. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her son

loans.name: Yina Aracelly

texts.es: Yina es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos los que ha criado con mucho esfuerzo. Ella trabaja como enfermera en un centro de salud y así le brinda el sustento y le da estudios a sus hijos. Solicita este crédito para hacer mejoras en su hogar, desea comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, perlines y bloques para en un futuro realizar un anexo en la parte trasera de su casa, esta obra no la puede realizar de un solo pago, ya que sus ingresos son bajos, de esta manera Yina pretende mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar junto a su familia.
texts.en: Yina is a single mother of two children that she has worked hard to raise. She works as a nurse in a health center, which is how she is able to feed and send her children to school. She is requesting this loan to make improvements in her home. She will purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, construction sheets, and cinder blocks so that in the future, she can build an annex in the back part of her house. She can't make this happen on just one paycheck, as she doesn't make a lot of money. Yina hopes to improve her home and her living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for a future expansion to her home.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano es un señor  soltero de 33 años de edad, quien tiene dos hijos,  una mujer  y un hombre quienes viven en el Caserío El Oratorio, Cantón Chuaxic, Sololá, Sololá.
El se dedica al trabajo de campo como agricultor. Eligio esta actividad porque le gusta relacionarse con la naturaleza, por medio de lo que cultiva obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos  por  lo que  ya lleva 8 años en esta labor.
Comenta que ahora el cultivo de cebolla le genera mejores ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan aportar a la economía de su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,500.00 para la compra de semillas de cebolla y abono orgánico para poder cultivar y distribuirlo en el mercado local  para mejorar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es adquirir más terrenos para poder cultivar y así sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariano is 33 years old and single. He has two children, a girl and a boy, who live in the hamlet of El Oratorio in the canton of Chuaxic, which is in the department and city of Sololá. Mariano is a farmer, and he says that he chose this work because he likes working with nature. He has been a farmer for eight years now, and he earns most of his income from the crops that he grows. Mariano says that onions are now a more profitable crop, and that the higher income helps him to support his family.

Mariano is requesting this loan of 7,500 GTQ to buy onion seeds and organic fertilizer for his crops, which he hopes to sell in the local market to improve his income. Mariano says that his dream is to buy more land to farm so that he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Irfah

texts.en:
Irfah, 25, is a young and newly married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She was married a few months ago and found that her husband’s income is very poor; he cannot bear all the household expenses alone. She estimated all the household expenses, compared them with her husband's income and concluded that it is not sufficient.

Irfah then decided to start a tailoring business at home so that she could reach the estimated additional income. She does not, however, have a sufficient amount to buy a sewing machine. She has therefore requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a new sewing machine. She hopes that she will find good customers and is able to sew impressive designs for them soon.

Irfah has recently started her new life and has good financial expectations of her husband in the future. Her dream is to spend her life with peaceful manners. She wants her husband to adopt a profitable business so that she can run her household smoothly. 

Irfah is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a small plot of land

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es el segundo de 4 hermanos, su hermano mayor estudio una carrera universitaria a medias y la dejó, el aspira llegar a ser licenciado en  Administración Agraria con voluntad y empeño, actualmente ayuda a su madre que es modista con algunas tareas como poda y limpieza de patios, es un joven muy luchador con ganas de salir adelante. No quiere depender de sus padres y quiere trabajar en un establecimiento ganadero como administrador, ese es su sueño
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y así poder cubrir sus gastos y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Marcos is the second of 4 siblings, his older brother studied half a university degree but then left. With will and determination he aspires to graduate in Agricultural Administration. He currently helps his mother, a dressmaker, with certain tasks such as pruning and the cleaning of patios. He is a strong-willed young man with a desire to succeed in life. He does not want to rely on his parents and wants to work on a farm as an administrator - this is his dream.
He is applying for this loan in order to invest it in paying for his university fees, and therefore to be able to pay for his expenses and to keep studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo, de 21 años, es soltero y vive alojado  en la casa de sus padres. El trabajo de Ricardo consiste en el transporte, el cual lo realiza en su mototaxi. Esta actividad lo realiza buscando pasajeros para llevar a sus destinos por todas las calles  de la ciudad.  Se inició en ésta actividad por que vio que hay mucha demanda en el medio de transporte, al comienzo le era complicado su trabajo, porque no conocía todas las zonas de la ciudad. Viene realizando ésta actividad desde hace 01 año, tiempo que le sirvió para hacerse conocido por el buen servicio que brinda. Le gusta mucho su oficio ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos a parte de darle facilidad de conocer mucha gente e interactuar, además de manejar su propio horario de trabajo y es independiente. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, esta muy contento de saber que tiene un respaldo económico que le permite seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado de 600 soles, comprará piezas y repuestos como llantas, cámaras, rodajes y otros, para arreglar su mototaxi y darle su mantenimiento así estará operativo y trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Ricardo, age 21, is single, and he lives in his parents’ house.  Ricardo’s work is transportation, which he does in his ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  He does this business activity by looking for passengers to take to their destinations on all of the streets of the city.  He started this business activity because he saw that there was a big demand in the field of transportation.

When he started, his work was complicated for him because he did not know all of the areas of the city.  He has been doing this business activity for one year.  This time served him to become known for the good service he provides.  He likes his job a lot because it allows him to have good income.  It also lets him easily meet a lot of people and interact with them.  Additionally, he manages his own work schedule and is independent.

This is his first loan with Kiva.  He is very happy to know that he has financial backing that will allow him to get ahead.  He will use the requested 600 soles to buy parts and replacements like tires, inner tubes, wheels, and others in order to fix his mototaxi and provide it with maintenance.  This way it will be operational and working without problems.

loans.use: to buy parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en:
Bernadetha, 27, is married to Rino, 32. They are blessed with one child, Yohanes, who is 10 and in the fourth grade at elementary school.
 
Bernadetha is a fish monger. She buys fish from local fishermen to sell by walking around the neighborhood. She runs this business to improve her family's income. Her husband, Rino, cannot afford to meet their daily needs with his income as a labourer.

To improve her business, Bernadetha plans to buy more fish and to raise goats. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 Indonesian rupiah from the Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation.

loans.use: to buy more fish and goats

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Grace is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Grace has been raising ducks for ten years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Anamaria

texts.es:
Anamaria está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, lo cual siempre quiso, comenta que de aquí a un tiempo se ve trabajando en la carrera que está estudiando, y ayudando a las personas que necesiten de atención en su salud.
Se ve haciendo cursos para poder seguir creciendo en su conocimiento y traer nuevas técnicas que aplicar con los pacientes. Quiere también poder ayudar a su familia y retribuirles todo lo que ellos hicieron por ella.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de sus estudios, ya que quiere seguir estudiando y luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Anamaria is studying for a nursing career, which she has always wanted.  She says that some time from now she sees herself working in the career that she is studying.  She sees herself helping people who need health attention.

She is taking courses to be able to continue growing in her knowledge and bringing new techniques to apply with the patients.  She also wants to be able to help her family, and to repay them for everything they have done for her.

She is now requesting this loan to be able to make her educational payments.  This is because she wants to continue studying and struggling to get ahead.

loans.use: to make payments to the university.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia está estudiando la carrera de Enfermería, desea poder culminar sus estudios para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de los ingresos que recibe. Ella es una persona ejemplar y dedicada.
Comenta que ayuda en el negocio familiar y que también estudia, ya que quiere ser una profesional exitosa y útil a los demás.
Ella pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su carrera, para poder seguir estudiando y luchando por su objetivo.
texts.en: Julia is studying a degree in nursing. She would like to be able to complete her studies in order to help her family with the income she will earn. She is a dedicated and exemplary person.  She says that she helps in the family business while also studying, because she wants to be a successful professional and helpful to others. She requests this loan in order to be able to invest it in her degree fees, to be able to continue studying and to strive for her future goal.

loans.use: to pay degree fees

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 54-year-old rice farmer from Trinidad Bohol.  She is married, with an adult son. 

For 15 years now, Lucia has farmed rice and raised hogs for an income. This brings her an average income of 3,000 PHP per month. She continues to work hard to be self-sufficient. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and piglets to raise in her barn. Her profits provide food for herself and her husband. 

In the future, she hopes to buy more land to cultivate to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 52 years old and married, with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Juliet has a business selling sand gravel in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of sand and gravel to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business .

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sand and gravel.

loans.name: Sunny Boy

texts.en:
Sunny Boy is a single farmer who operates his own farm in Camanse, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, to earn a living. He used to help his parents to make their harvest an abundant one. 

He borrowed 10,000 PHP from Gata Daku  MPC micro-credit to plow the farm and pay for weeding.  He is hopeful that through this loan, he will be able to gain more income for his future needs.

loans.use: to plow his farm and pay for weeding

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela, a sus 21 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Durante su vida productiva trabajó 3 años en un almacén vendiendo mercancía pero, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos decidió iniciar con su propio negocio, por lo que empezó a vender mercancía puerta a puerta y así fue consiguiendo su clientela que se encuentra ubicada especialmente en un pueblo al cual se traslada cada 15 días para ofrecer y entregar los productos encargados, luego se devuelve a la ciudad donde reside, allí alterna su negocio, manejando una tienda que es propiedad de un familiar, de esta manera obtiene ingresos adicionales para seguir aportando a la economía de su hogar. La cliente es una joven dinámica, emprendedora, apasionada por lo que hace, pues manifiesta que tiene la ventaja de manejar su propio tiempo, puede alternar diferentes actividades mientras que genera ingresos. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (ropa sport, ropa interior, entre otros), de esta manera podrá tener más variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y así mejorar las ventas y por ende los ingresos. Gisela sueña con poder seguir con su negocio de manera independiente, fortalecerlo, acreditarlo para que sea rentable y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para mejorar su bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gisela, just 21 years old but already very productive, is single and has no children.  She started by working in a store selling goods, but wanting to earn more money, she decided to start her own business. She began to sell goods door-to-door to gain a customer base. Her customers principally live in a town that she goes to every fifteen days, selling and delivering her products. She then returns to her hometown and runs a store on the property of a family member. By alternating her business like this, she is able to keep on supporting her household economy.

Gisela is a dynamic, entrepreneurial young woman, and passionate about what she does. With the advantage of being able to manage her own time, she alternates between different activities while earning her income. The loan she is currently requesting would be used to buy goods at wholesale, particularly athletic wear and undergarments, among other things. This will allow her to have a greater variety of products on hand to meet her customers' needs and increase her sales and income. Gisela dreams of continuing with her independent business, of strengthening it and making it profitable so that it guarantees her positive economic stability, improved well being, and quality of life.

loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing for resale

loans.name: Breni

texts.en:
Breni is 55 years old and married, and she is blessed with three children. Two of her children have married, while the other is single and  working as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). 

Breni owns a retail store and offers foods within her locality. She has been engaged to this type of business for mor than 20 years. 

Breni aims to become a successful entrepreneur someday, so she is seeking a loan of PHP 18,000. Her loan will be used to buy grocery items, such as soft drinks and different kinds of frozen foods to restock her retail store. 

Breni believes that her additional capital will help her fulfill her dreams.  She can satisfy her customers' demand, which leads to good sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, such as soft drinks and different kinds of frozen foods for her retail store

loans.name: Xinia María

texts.es:
Doña Xinia es una clienta visionaria, con gran experiencia comercial en la rama de servicios, ofrece el servicio al público  de pago de servicios como luz, agua, telefonía, internet  , alquiler de locales . Quiere implementar un negocio de librería y cafetería, considerando el crecimiento de población en su comunidad y surgimiento de nuevas necesidades.
El propósito de mantener su negocio y ampliarlo, es asegurarse  ella y su esposo una vejez con calidad de vida.
Y ofrecer nuevos servicios a los habitantes de su comunidad.
texts.en: Xinia is a visionary client, with extensive commercial experience in the services sector, providing public payment services for services such as electricity, water, telephone, internet and rental of premises. She wants to create a bookshop and café, taking into account the population growth in the community and the emergence of new needs. The intention is to support her business and expand it, in order to ensure that she and her husband have an old age with a good quality of life. This business will also offer new services to the people of her community.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her bookstore and cafeteria

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia tiene 24 años de edad, es de familia muy humilde, ella estudia la carrera de Lic. en Contabilidad Pública y Finanzas. Marcia no está trabajando, pero gracias al apoyo de su hermano ha podido continuar con sus estudios. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su profesión, el cual está a pocos meses de finalizarlo, ya una vez con titulo en mano le será más fácil optar por un empleo, que le permitirá ayudar a su familia con sus ingresos.
texts.en: Marcia is 24 years old, from a very humble family and she is studying a degree in Public Accounting and Finance. Marcia is not currently employed, but as a result of the help of her brother she has been able to continue with her studies. She is applying for a loan in order to pay for her degree course, which she will complete in only a few months. Once with the degree in hand, it will be easier for her to find a job with an income that enables her to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for degree course fees

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Née vers 1965, Fanta vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de DANGASSA. 
Fanta s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. Fanta, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente d’arachide, de niébé, de mil, de fonio,  de maïs, de dah, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les quatre prêts précédents, Fanta est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 sacs de mil, auprès des paysans producteurs (à DANGASSA, GOUALA et NIANGADINA) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, à DANGASSA et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
Fanta  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Fanta lives with her 6 children and her husband in a nuclear family in the rural community of Dangassa. Fanta's rapid interest in business is due to her aunt, who owned a small business of assorted products. 

Fanta, after many years of experience in her aunt's business, decided to go into the business of purchase and resale of ground nuts, black-eyed peas, millet, fonio (a species of millet), corn, bissap, etc.

After having fully repaid the four previous loans, Fanta is on her fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso which she will use to purchase 100 bags of millet from local farmers (in Dangassa, Gouala, and Niangadina) and rarely from local wholesalers. She conducts her sales in cash and on credit, by retail, from her home, in Dangassa, and in local markets to a customer base made up essentially of consumers. 

Fanta hopes to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA which she will use to help her husband provide for the family's needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen is from Yerevan town, where he lives with his parents, sister and wife. 

Vigen works at a local company as an estimator and sustains his family's living expenses. To tackle financial hardships, Vigen purchased a car six months ago, and his father started to provide taxi service to locals. So these changes helped the family to become financially more stable. 

Installing a gas cylinder on the car would greatly assist Vigen and his father to save money, but unfortunately for now they have no financial means of doing that. 

Vigen requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. 

Vigen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So with this loan Virab and his father will be able to make the installation and gather more income for their family.

loans.use: to pay for installing a gas cylinder on his taxi

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
Bibiana es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, comenta que su meta es terminar la Universidad, realizar la tesis y poder desempeñarse como una profesional, y de a poco ir consiguiendo mas trabajos en mas hospitales y de ese modo ayudar a su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y es algo que la apasiona mucho. Es una joven con muchas expectativas y quiere poder cumplir sus sueños.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y gastos de titulación, y así poder estar cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Bibiana is from the city of Paraguarí. She says that her goal is to finish university, to complete her thesis and to be able to work as a professional, and gradually get more work in more hospitals, thereby being able to help her family. She is studying a Nursing degree, and it is something that she is very passionate about. She is a young woman with high expectations and she wants to be able to fulfil her dreams. She is applying for this loan in order to pay for her degree fees and expenses, so that she can be one step closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay for degree fees and expenses

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 50 years old. She lives in the Martvili District with her husband and grown daughter. 

Nona works at a livestock feed store as a saleslady and gets a modest monthly wage.  Besides, the family runs an agrobusiness and sells the harvested laurel leaves and nuts, which are grown on a family-owned plot of land.  They nevertheless live in poverty because their income is not enough for their three-member family. 

Nona has requested a loan to start a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers,” due to their low incomes. 

The loan will be used for purchasing a milk cow. Nona will place the cow in the cattle shed located in her yard and will start selling the milk at the local market. The family's income should increase by 150–200 GEL (Georgian Lari), which is a 40% to 50% increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to start up a dairy farm

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 53 años, está casada con Rómulo con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 30, 21, 15 y 11 años de edad, tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de sus hijos y su esposo. EL trabajo de Yolanda consiste en la venta de pescado, sale temprano al puerto principal de la ciudad en busca de los pescados mas grandes y frescos, de ahí sale a la carretera, ahí tiene clientes que siempre le esperan para poder comprarle sus pescado que siempre tienen un buen precio, lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años y lo hace sola, espera poder consolidarse aun mas con su venta y poner un almacén de venta de pescado fresco y seco.Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará pescado al por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Yolanda is 53 years old and is married to Rómulo with whom she has four children aged 30, 21, 15 and 11. She has her own house and lives alongside her husband and children. Yolanda sells fish for a living. She leaves the city's main port early in search of bigger and fresher fish. From here she then hits the road, where she has clients that are always waiting in order to buy her fish, which she always sells at a good price. She has been doing this job for 10 years and works alone. She hopes to be able to consolidate sales even more and have a shop selling both fresh and dried fish.  This will be her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial help that she receives in order to continue her work. She promises to pay her dues in a timely manner. With the amount requested (S/.1000 soles) she will buy fish wholesale in order to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Jojo

texts.en:
This is Jojo, 34, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, in the Philippines.  His partner is Mardeth, and they have two children.  Together with his partner, he manages the household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jojo operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. He rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in his business. 

Jojo hopes to expand his business, and he dreams of giving his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  There he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en: Jayson resides and has his farm in Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is a widow and has four children. In order to generate more harvest, he has borrowed 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure in order to improve his farm. He is hopeful to support the needs of his children and to be able to give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane appreciates her previous Kiva loan.  It improved her standard of living and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy cooking oil, sugar, maize flour, and soap for resale.  She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sugar, maize flour and soap for resale

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y padre de tres hijos de 10, 14 y 16 años de edad. Desde hace 20 años trabaja como operario nocturno en un cultivo de flores y, de manera independiente trabaja en un coche de tracción animal, en el que presta el servicio de transporte de materiales para construcción, acarreos, insumos agrícolas y mercancía en general, labor que aprendió de su padre quien toda su vida realizó este tipo de labor. Alternando ambas actividades es como Luis genera los ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y solventar los gastos mensuales del hogar. El cliente es un hombre pujante, emprendedor, activo y lucha incansablemente para salir adelante, sobrepasando los diversos obstáculos que se le presentan y trabajando arduas y agotadoras jornadas, todo con el fin de cumplir el sueño de seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y en un futuro cercano, independizarse totalmente y generar empleo entre sus familiares. Esto lo lleva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, el cual invertirá en la compra de un caballo y un coche de tracción animal, para poder brindar empleo a un familiar y así aumentar los ingresos que complementa con el salario de su actual empleo en el cultivo de flores, de esta forma podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, tendrá una estabilidad económica favorable que le permitirá brindar mejor educación a sus hijos y  disfrutar de un futuro más próspero en compañía de los suyos.
texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old, married and father to three children aged 10,14 and 16 years old. For twenty years he has worked as a night laborer at a flower nursery and on his own with a horse and cart. He provides services for transporting construction materials, supplies, agricultural materials, and general merchandise. He learned this from this father who did this all his life. Between the two activities Luis generates enough income to cover the daily and monthly expenses of his household. This client is a vigorous, enterprising and active man, forever-struggling to get ahead, overcoming the various difficulties that arise, working arduous and tiring days. All with the goal of accomplishing his dream of continuing to strengthen his business. And in the near future he hopes to become totally independent and be able to employ some of his family. 

For these reasons he is requesting this loan to buy a horse and horse cart to provide employment for a family member. Also he wants to increase his income. Which added to the salary from his job at the flower farm he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family and enjoy a favorable economic situation. That would allow him to provide his children with better education and enjoy a more prosperous future together with his family.

loans.use: to buy a horse and cart.

loans.name: Sulkhan

texts.en:
Sulkhan is a 30 year-old married man. He lives in a small village in the Bolnisi district with his wife and six-year-old son. Sulkhan runs a food market with the help of his wife.  His son will soon go to school and their income will not cover all the expenses, therefore he has decided to expand his business. 

Sulkhan has sought credit from local financial institutions in the past, but his attempts have been unsuccessful because of his poor standard of living. Under a start-up program, which is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, rural poor and inexperienced people are able to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $3,600.  

With the loan, he plans to purchase a truck and start trading fruits and vegetables. He will also sell fruits and vegetables in his shop and thus will be able to offer his clients a wider assortments of products. This will significantly increase sales and income will be increased. Thanks to the start-up program Sulkhan will be able to save and provide a better future for his son.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and start trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 38 years old, and she lives in Compound #3 with her eight children between the ages of 10 and 27 who are in school and live at home, 

For the past 14 years Anna has been selling used clothes. Some business problems she is facing include the high price of used clothes. She says she makes a lot of profit since she sells different kinds of used clothes. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her, too. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business.  Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with three children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business of tailoring at the market and sells on both wholesale and retail basis. She has been in the tailoring business for 13 years and she works six days a week.   She has applied for a loan of Ugandan shillings 1,200,000 from Kiva partner MCDTSACCO in order to buy more rolls of cloth and threads. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality (the rainy season) which hinders her customers to reach her and defaulters. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and also to buy a plot of land.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more cloth.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: John Bosco comes from rural Kibiriizi in Nsasi and he is married with a family of five children. He has a retail shop and does cattle fattening as his main sources of income. John Bosco has children in school and that is his main challenge since he has to have income to pay their school fees. He therefore wants the loan to help him pay tuition for his children before they are sent away from school.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Sara's Group

texts.en:
Sara is 25-years-old and is a young Iraqi woman from the south of the country. She is unmarried and lives with her family. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Sara is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home.  She uses her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Sara has five years experience and has been working hard to attract clients, improve her skills and increase her productivity. One obstacle she has is the lack of reliable power supply in her area and that having access to electricity for only a few hours a day leaves little predictability about the exact hours when she will be able to work. To overcome this problem she is taking a loan from Kiva partner Relief International Microfinance Iraq in order to buy a generator and an A/C for her work area. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers have been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a generator and an A/C.

loans.name: Raswa

texts.en:
The story of Sigit, son of Raswa:

I came from an unpretentious family. My family condition makes it difficult for me to continue my studies any further. It's been difficult for us to fund our daily needs, so thinking about getting into vocational school seems impossible. My parents have no fixed occupation. The unstable income makes things more complicated. My parents have to fund my brother who's still studying in junior high too. I hope that joining Kiva would help me to be able to continue my studies.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina de 50 años de edad, está casada con Eduardo quien se dedica al comercio y  es padre de sus 6 hijos quienes ya son independientes. Esta  instalado cómodamente en su casa propia. Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de pescados al por mayor, se traslada y vende en otras ciudades donde los oferta a un buen precio, obteniendo mayores ganancias. También cuenta con 01 mototaxi que compró con sus ganancias y lo alquila a su vecino. Se inicio hace más de 05 años por la iniciativa de su pareja quien aprendió a éste oficio en otra ciudad, siendo él quien compra  éste producto y lo congela para su venta en los mercados alejados realizando solo entregas a pedido. Le gusta su actividad por el ingreso económico que recibe para seguir adelante. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles comprara pescado al por mayor.
texts.en: Alejandrina is 50 years old. She is married to Eduardo who works in commerce. He is the father of her 6 children who are now independent. She is settled comfortably and has her own home. Alejandrina sells fish wholesale. She travels around and sells fish in other cities where they offer her a good price, giving her higher profits. Also, she has a 01 mototaxi that she bought with her earnings, and she rents it to her neighbour. She began more than 5 years ago on the advice of her partner who did this job in another city, where he would buy the product and freeze it for sale in distant markets, only making deliveries when requested. She likes this activity for the income it provides so that she can continue working. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is requesting a small loan which she will use to achieve her goals. With the amount requested (600 nuevos soles) she will buy wholesale fish.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Fredy Celestino

texts.es:
Fredy es un joven soltero de 24 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en la Aldea Panimatzalam San Andres Semetabaj, Sololá.
El es un hombre trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Actualmente cuenta con un internet a unos metros de su vivienda. Eligio esta actividad porque  donde vive no hay un servicio de internet, es por ello que tomo  la iniciativa para poder ayudar a los estudiantes a que realicen sus diferentes tareas sin tener que salir fuera de la comunidad.
Gracias a su esfuerzo el ahora puede ayudar a su familia a contribuir en los gastos, ya que su negocio le genera  buenos ingresos y ganancias.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 9,000.00 para ampliar su negocio y generar más ganancias y así tener contar con más variedades de productos de cómputo para ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para comprar más computadoras y así abrir otro negocio,  con la finalidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy is a single 24-year-old man, living with his parents and siblings in the village of Panimatzalam San Andres Semetabaj, in Sololá. He is a hard-working man who strives for his family's well-being. 

Currently, he has an internet business a few meters away from his home. He chose this activity because where he lives, there is no internet service, so he took this initiative to be able to help students complete their homework without having to leave the community. Thanks to his efforts, he can now contribute to his family's expenses, as his business provides him with good income and earnings. 

He is requesting a loan of 9,000 quetzales to expand his business and generate greater earnings, and provide a greater variety of computing products to offer better service to his customers. His dream is to earn enough to purchase more computers and open another business, with the goal of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his internet service business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia, de 39 años, está casada con Juan y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales tres ya son mayores e independientes por eso solo vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Emilia, se dedica a la venta de comida, se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado a buscar los mejores productos para la cocina, busca entre sus caseros verduras frescas, frutas dulces, carnes saludables, para que de ahí vaya a su casa a preparar los deliciosos platos que le caracterizan y motivo por el que tiene muchos clientes, tiene este negocio por aproximadamente 05 años, trabaja sola y desde que empezó sus clientes van casi a diario a su puesto de venta. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener tiempo disponible para dedicarse a su casa, además que puede realizar algunas otras actividades. Por tanto éste será su segundo préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará ingredientes tales como arroz, verduras, carnes entre otros ingredientes para seguir con su venta de comida.
texts.en:
Emilia, 39, is married to Juan and has five children, three of whom are adults and live independently; she lives with only two of them in her own home. Emilia is engaged in food sales. She rises very early to go to the market to find the best products for her kitchen. She looks among her vendors for fresh vegetables, sweet fruits, and healthy meats, to then go home and prepare the delicious meals that characterize her business and attract her many customers. 

She has owned this business for approximately 5 years. She works alone, and ever since she began, her customers come her stall almost daily. What she likes about her work is that it allows her some time to take care of her home, as well as other activities. 

This will be her second loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to get ahead. With the requested amount of 1,000 soles she will purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and meat, among others, to continue with her food sales.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and meat, among others.

loans.name: Alaa's Group

texts.en:
Alaa is a married, hard working Iraqi man, living in the south of the country. He is 29-years-old and with his wife they are raising three children. Alaa has a tannery business. Tanning is the process of treating skins of animals in order to produce leather which is more durable and less susceptible to decomposition. Traditionally, tanning used tannin, an acidic chemical compound from which the tanning process draws its name.

Alaa has 10 years experience in the business which he would like to expand and develop by increasing his capital and purchasing more raw materials to work with helping him to increase his sales in final products. To enable the growth, he is taking a loan from Kiva partner Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to work with.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia offers street foods and hog feed as her additional source of income. She has run her eatery for over nine years and has been selling hog feed for six months. Cresencia is 48-years-old and is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer within their locality.

Cresencia plans to purchase stocks of hog feed, raw meat, different kinds of vegetables and some street foods in order to satisfy her costumer’s demands and obtain better income. For this reason, she decided to request a loan of PHP14,000. She knows that this amount of loan will improve her sales, profit and way of life. She hopes and prays that lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of hog feed, raw meat, different kinds of vegetables and some street foods for her food production sales.

loans.name: Kariakoo Group

texts.en:
Kashinde, who is in her early 20s, is married with one child who goes to school.  She has been running a business of selling clothes, bags and shoes door to door, for five years now.  She works from 8.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kashinde's first loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to buy more bags, clothes and shoes to resell. She dreams of owing a place to sell her products.

Kashinde will share this loan with her loan group "Kariakoo" which has nine members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bags, clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима родилась в 1964 года. Она трудолюбивая и великодушная женщина. Фотима замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Трое из ее детей совершеннолетние и семейные. Младший ее ребенок в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Фотима хочет, чтобы ее дети были высококвалифицированными специалистами. Ее муж имеет Камаз и занимается перевозкой грузов. Этим он подрабатывает на жизнь. Фотима должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына в университете. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Fotima was born in 1964.  She is a hardworking and generous woman who is currently married and raising 4 children.  Three of her children are adults and have their own families.  The youngest is her son, who earlier this year finished secondary school and has been accepted to a university.  Fotima wants her children to be highly-qualified university graduates.  Her husband has a trucking license and uses it to transport goods and earn some extra money for the family.  Fotima has to pay for her son's university tuition, which is why she is requesting a loan.  She is placing her hopes in you, and looks forward to your kindness and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
29-year-old Cynthia from Liberia lives in Compound#3 with her two children aged two and nine.  Only one child is in school and they both live at home. 

Over the past nine years she has been selling rice and oil at the local market. Some problems she faces are the high prices of oil and rice, but some time she realizes little profit because she have to convert the LRD to USD in order to buy her goods (rice and oil). She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her.  She sells nine hours each day in a week. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy goods (rice and oil) to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a long-time client at the branch and has borrowed several times from the institution. He is involved in farming, which is his major source of income.  He started this business in 2001. His tea garden is in Kyamuhunga–Bushenyi and he works in the tea growing business an average of 6 days per week and 8 hours per day. 

He started the business so he could get enough income to cater to his family's needs. In addition to the tea business, he also has a retail shop in Kyamuhunga which gives him more income that helps him to provide for his family. His main client is a major tea factory in the area. He supplies them all of the tea he harvests during a given period. He would like to use the loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) to buy fertilizer for better harvests. Despite the challenge of unfavorable weather conditions, Moses hopes to continue to be an honest and hard-working person and believes that his tea garden will soon expand.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Don Virgilio de 63 años, es una persona emprendedora, humilde y muy trabajadora, que se dedica a cultivar  granos básicos y al mismo tiempo a cuidar sus animales domésticos y un par de vacas, que le dan el sustento diario para su familia. Además, es una persona muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su comunidad y forma parte de la directiva de la comunidad.

Aparte de esto, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo menor, su esposa y 2 de sus hijas para realizar las labores del hogar y cuidar los animales.

Don Virgilio, se  ha dedicado a trabajar la agricultura desde muy pequeño, con su padre y desde entonces, ya tenía la idea de tener animales que fuera rentable criar y vender para cubrir algunas necesidades de su hogar. Cuando se caso,  decidió comprar una mancuerna de cerdos y engordarlos para venderlos y así tener ingresos extras, sin mayores costos para su familia. A la fecha tiene aproximadamente 40 años de dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una mancuerna de cerdos y a mejorar las condiciones y el mantenimiento de los animales. Con el objetivo de que sus ingresos en la temporada de fin de año sean mayores. Además, agradece a la fundación campo y por el apoyo que le ha brindado para solventar la necesidad de incrementar sus animales. Espera, seguir trabajando de la mano con la fundación para ver crecer el desarrollo de su comunidad.

Esta pensando, que para un futuro sacar su próximo crédito, para establecer sus cultivos y para seguir con la crianza de cerdos, u otros rubros que le generen ingresos que solventen las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 62 years old.  He is an enterprising, humble and very hard-working person who makes a living growing basic grains.  He also looks after domestic animals and has a couple of cows.  This all provides him with an income to support his family.  Virgilio is also very dedicated to his community and its development and he is a part of the local council.

Virgilio receives help with the work at home and looking after the animals from his youngest son, his wife, and his two daughters.

Virgilio has been working in farming from a very young age with his father and, since then, he always had the idea of having animals that were profitable to raise and sell.  With this he would be able to cover some household costs.  When he married, Virgilio decided to buy a couple of pigs to fatten up and sell, so as to have an extra income, and without spending too much more.
